results.description:
We want to make our services available to everyone. Some can’t spare the time for one of our standard appointments, or can’t afford even our low-cost/pay-what-you-can consultation option. Recognizing this, we will offer short, focused mini-consultations, including one herbal preparation, for free to all comers. This is your opportunity to talk with a practicing herbalist, share any health concerns you may have, and receive personalized education in the preparation and use of herbs.

Sunday, April 17th, 2016
1:00pm – 5:00pm
25 St. Mary’s Court, Brookline

The consultation and one preparation are free. (Donations are accepted.)

For this free clinic day, we cannot schedule specific individual appointment times – everything will be first come, first served. If we have a high turnout this may entail some wait time. We expect the mini-consultations themselves to run approximately 20 minutes each, plus 5-10 minutes for preparation of herbs.

Please spread the word! We would especially like to reach out to underserved individuals who would not otherwise have access to herbal medicine.

Please note: this is not a medical clinic: we are not doctors, we are not dispensing medical advice, and we are not diagnosing or treating any medical conditions. We are providing information and education from the perspective of traditional herbalism. The herbal preparations we provide are to be considered samples to aid in your personal investigation into the effects of herbs in your own body.

If you plan to come by, it helps us if you RSVP by filling out our contact form, emailing us at [masked], or calling[masked]-5274.

Please join us for a pleasant afternoon of competitive party bridge.

Bertucci's has its own parking lot, a welcoming atmosphere, and hearty food (including all-you-can-eat salads and soups).

Please sign up by Saturday afternoon, the day before the game. If at least 5 players have not registered by then, the game will have to be cancelled for that week.

You must know Contract Bridge rules and basic bidding to play. No formal training will be offered, but this is a social, casual event, and bidding advice and meanings will be openly discussed at any player's request.

ACBL Yellow Card is our group-standard bidding system; a novice should please take time to study all basic openings and responses shown above, plus standard Jacoby Transfer and Stayman responses to NT openings. We will expect a verbal alert on deviations an expert may make to these most-common conventions.

results.description:
Not to be confused with a recent horror film with a similar name, "The Witches" is an adaptation of the popular 1983 children's book by Roald Dahl. The film was not a big hit on its initial release in 1990, but it has gained a loyal cult audience over the years. 

Directed by Nicolas Roeg ("The Man Who Fell to Earth" and "Don't Look Now"), produced by Muppets creator Jim Henson and starring Anjelica Huston as the lead villain, "The Witches" is one of those "kids" films that isn't afraid to go to some weird and dark places. The movie hasn't been on the big screen in awhile, so let's check it out and see how well it holds up all these years later.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d_ZyqaN_XNM


The movie will be playing on April the 17th at the Brattle Theater in Cambridge, MA. It doesn't start until 1:30 PM, but I will be outside the theater about 15-20 minutes earlier with a Meetup sign. Once the group is together, we can grab some snacks and seats.

If you have never been to the Brattle, below are directions to the theater by car or public transportation.

http://www.brattlefilm.org/about-2/directions-parking/

Hope to see you then.
results.name: The Witches (1990)

results.description:
Nectar is a talk-free dance inspired by conscious and ecstatic dance. It is a space to enjoy and explore embodiment, physical expression, and the body’s wisdom. After an unguided warm-up period, the Facilitator-DJ leads a brief opening circle on a theme or guided practice, followed by a playlist of music—beginning spacious and mellow, gaining intensity, and arriving back into stillness. Participants are welcome to move, dance, and be still as their bodies desire. Nectar closes with a sharing circle in which participants are welcome to speak about their experiences in the dance.

Nectar is offered primarily for adults. Children are welcome with adult accompaniment provided they can follow the talk-free and intentional structure and be mindful of their impact on others in the space. Kids under 6 can come for free, and ages 6-12 for half price ($5-7). $10-15 for adults.

Nectar was created by Amorn O’Connor and Harrison Blum, and is supported by a rotating crew of Facilitator-DJs.

Please note that many more people attend than RSVP via Meetup!

On the horizon-- I'll be holding a book release for Dancing with Dharma April 27 from 6:30-8pm in Harvard Divinity School's Andover Chapel (45 Francis St, Cambridge). The event will feature brief guided contemplative movement, remarks from me and a few book contributors- including Lama Willa Miller- and plenty of time for questions and discussion. Here's the Facebook page and a flier is attached.

I'll have discount copies of the book available for cash purchase at both these events- selling for $30 instead of the online price of $45.

Lastly, profuse apologies for anyone who showed up to our last Nectar-- which was canceled due to a scheduling error made by the Dance Complex. We've checked in with them, and they've assured us the issue has been remedied.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be two flights up from the ground level in Studio 2.

results.description:
TIME TO COME OUT OF HIBERNATION FOR THE NEXT PUGGIE MEETUP!


Now that the spring weather has rolled around, we'll be back with the first Puggie Sunday social of 2016 at Assistant Organizer Sharon's home in Carver - where Millie, Max, and Griswold the UN-Pug hang out. This is our favorite location - a quiet, rural side street with plenty of parking, a HUGE fenced yard, plenty of chairs, and lots and lots of flat grassy green space to run and run and run!

Remember that your host provides the soft drinks and paperware for each meetup, but we count on our members to bring the snacks. Feel free to bring snacks for the Pugs, but try to bring soft snacks so that Clovis can have some too! If you are coming to your first meetup, please be sure to let us know, so we can introduce you to everyone and make you and your Puggies feel welcome!

WOULD YOU LIKE TO HOST A MEETUP?

Please let your organizer know!

We are very fortunate to have Sharon host most of our fair weather meetups during the course of the year, with occasional help from myself, but we are always delighted to change the venue when someone else wants to host a meetup.  We are looking for folks to host meetups on either Saturday or Sunday!

We're hoping that the folks who have hosted before will be able will step in and host a social or two in 2016. For those who haven't hosted before, but would like to try, and if you do have a fenced yard large enough to accommodate anywhere from 20 to 40 Puggies and a few assorted other small breeds, please let your organizer know. We would like to give everyone a chance to host who would like to host! It's fun!

ABOUT THE MEETUPS

We're all responsible Pug owners here, so don't be concerned about your babies. Wherever we meet, we'll make sure to have shade and plenty of water for keeping Pugs cool. There will be soft drinks and something to snack on for the people attending! If you bring treats for the Pugs, please ONLY hand out treats around the central table where everyone can keep an eye on the dogs, DON'T FEED CLOVIS, and PLEASE BE SURE that nothing gets dropped - your organizer has a Pug (yes, that would be Clovis...) who has brain damage which makes it very difficult for him to swallow. You can't miss him, he is the Pug in the wheelchair.  I don't want Clovis to choke to death on a stolen treat, and I'm sure no one else does either.. Thank you for your consideration!

Other small dogs are welcome, but please ask in advance if you can bring dogs other than Pugs. If you have a little Puggie roughneck on your hands, you can bring him too - but be prepared to keep an eye on him. If he starts bullying or being too rough with another dog, give him a time out until he can get himself under control. We want everyone to have fun!

Your organizer pays $89.84 twice a year in January and July for the privilege of organizing the South of Boston Pug Meetups, and believe me, it's worth every penny for the fun we have. If you would like to help defray the costs, please make a voluntary contribution of $1.00 to Charlotte Creeley each time you attend. Remember, it's VOLUNTARY - even if I had to pay twice as much, it would be worth it for the just to see the smile on Clovis's and Cletus's faces when the Puggie meetups roll around.
results.name: The South of Boston April Pug Sunday Meetup

results.description:
Do you practice Emotional Freedom Technique on your own and want to join a tapping circle for even better results? Emotional Freedom Technique, also known as EFT or tapping, is a simple technique for releasing emotional blocks and reducing stress. Since stress is at the source of many ailments, the simple act of tapping stress away can have profound and life changing positive consequences.

EFT is a powerful way to change any area of life from emotional upsets to fears to trauma to removing blocks to a life filled with joy and peace! Ultimately it helps us to be ourselves, freeing ourselves up from the limitations of our past beliefs and the hold negative past experiences have had on us. Learn how to clear past events or memories that get triggered frequently. Remove the blocks to creating more abundance and success in your life and find out how you can use EFT to heal from chronic physical and/or emotional pain. Eliminate phobias, fears, anxiety, food cravings and feelings of sadness or depression.


A tapping circle is a group in which all members tap together and in turn on the issues that ail them. This process allows you to heal your issue whether you openly participate or prefer to remain private. Our tapping circle welcomes tappers of all levels, including complete beginners. What better way to try EFT than in a group setting where a strong and powerful synergy takes place between all present!

Please arrive early. Doors will open 15 minutes ahead of time and the tapping circle will begin promptly at 2 pm. Late comers will not be allowed in. A late arrival not only disrupts the flow of the circle, shatters the feeling of safety so necessary in healing work, but can also prevent the facilitator from pacing the circle well.

See you soon!

For more information on EFT: www.emofree.com and www.eftuniverse.com

For more information on the organizer and facilitator of the Boston Tapping Circles: www.luciemonroe.com

Feel free to email Lucie, the organizer, if you have questions.
results.name: EFT Tapping Circle

results.description:
A Special April Fool's Event

Join us to kick of Boston By Foot's 40th Anniversary tour season!


Ever heard that the truth is stranger than fiction? This Boston By Foot tour proves the point. True Lies & False Facts is the first “questionable” tour of Boston that keeps participants guessing. Strolling around the Jamaica Plain neighborhood, this tour will tell some crazy stories – some of which are true and others are not. Is your knowledge of history good enough to know which is which? At the end of this questionable tour, your tour group and guide will go to Doyle's Cafe to uncover Boston's truth to win prizes! Light snacks will be provided; cash bar and full menu will be available. We'll wait until all the groups are finished before revealing the answers, so please plan to stick around until 4pm or so if you want to find out who wins!


This is the only time a Boston By Foot tour guide will ever intentionally lie to you... unless, of course, they're telling the truth!

Learn more and buy tickets here.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the Boston By Foot signs
results.name: True Lies and False Facts: A Questionable Tour of Boston

results.description:
WARNING: the meet up time now varies from week to week. if you can't make it, make sure you change your RSVP to No, such that someone else can take your spot.

We have rented 3 badminton courts at the BU Fitness & Recreation Center (regulation full sized courts).  The BU facility is immaculate and a fantastic place to play.


The fee (payable online when you RSVP) gets you into the BU Fitness & Recreation Center to play badminton for an hour and a half.  Part of the fee is for the court time and the rest is for your meetup group to cover other expenses, i.e. rackets, shuttlecocks/birdies, meetup.com fees. All fees collected go to pay the Group's expenses.

We have rackets and shuttles for everyone!

Expect to play doubles. The host can help to match up pairs but members are free to join in any game they want.  The courts are reserved only for Boston Badminton members.

Before asking a question, please read through the following FAQs:

Q: The meetup is full, can I come regardless and pay at the event?
A: No, there is limited space to make sure everyone gets to play. A few spots typically open up before the event.

Q: It's my first time, how do I find you?
A: Go to the BU Fitness & Recreation Center reception (see directions below), and tell them you're here with Boston Badminton. They'll tell you where the courts are, check you're on the list, and make you sign a waiver. The meeting point is on the courts.

Q: I am a BU student, do I get a discount?
A: No, BU charges us the same regardless of whether participants are at BU or not.


Directions:
Please click here for a google map to The BU Fitness & Recreation Center.  The easiest way to get to the FitRec center from within Boston is to take the Green Line (B)-Boston College to Saint Paul St.  Parking is limited but available.  Please click here for parking information.

Plan to grab a drink locally after if we have interest.

The club has full locker room and shower facilities.

Note: In addition to agreeing to the Meetup's Liability Waiver, all members must sign a Waiver of Liability Form in order to use BU's courts. This form is available at the front desk at the FitRec center.  We may ask you for your full name in order to help BU and the meetup comply with the liability procedures.

Let me know if you have any questions and I hope to see you there!

Liability Waiver

By attending a Boston Badminton meetup, you hereby agree to the terms of the following Liability Waiver:

The purpose of the following Liability Waiver is to protect Boston Badminton meetup members and group leaders from liability in case of accident or injury. All members must agree to the Liability Waiver in order to participate in the group and its activities.

As part of my membership to Boston Badminton on Meetup.com (hereinafter “Boston Badminton”), I hereby freely and voluntarily agree to the following Release, Acknowledgment of Risk, and Waiver of Liability:

In consideration of the opportunity to participate in events, activities, classes, and programs conducted by Boston Badminton and its affiliates in any venue, and to use equipment located therein, I, on behalf of myself and my minor children, do hereby release, hold harmless and forever discharge and agree not to sue Boston Badminton and its trustees, officers, agents, founders, members, volunteers and employees (together, "Meetup.com Group") from any and all claims, responsibilities or liabilities for injury or damages resulting from or arising out of my or my family’s use of, presence in, or participation in activities conducted at any venue rented or owned by Boston Badminton, whether or not caused by the ordinary negligence of Boston Badminton. I understand, recognize and acknowledge that certain activities conducted by Boston Badminton or taking place in venues rented or owned by Boston Badminton are potentially hazardous. I also acknowledge that it is my responsibility to follow instructions for any activity or use of equipment, and to seek help from the volunteers if I have any questions. I further understand that, notwithstanding precautions taken by Boston Badminton, sports and fitness activities involve a risk of injury and/or death. I/we are voluntarily participating in these activities and using equipment and machinery with knowledge of the dangers involved. I hereby agree to expressly assume and accept any and all risks associated with my participation in activities conducted by Boston Badminton and its affiliates. I have read the foregoing and hereby agree to be bound by same.
results.name: Badminton @ BU, SUN 2-3:30 pm (4/17/2016)

results.description:
The seminar will explore how people can use Scala and Apache Spark to solve complex problems using distributed computing systems. People who use Hadoop can see how spark can make their MapReduce jobs easy to write and manage.

Apache Spark is a fast engine for large-scale data processing - 100 times faster than Hadoop. Write applications quickly in Java, Scala or Python. Spark can perform complex analytics on data stored in Cassandra.
results.name: Scala and Apache Spark Fundamentals

results.description:
Kate has been driving to the city so far, so it's about time that we paid her a visit!
This is a neighborhood coffee shop, but the idea of it being The Third Place, mentioned on their website (http://www.redeyeroasters.com/#!thirdplace/c18na), is quite intriguing!
The shop is in Hingham, MA and is about 35 mins drive from the City.
We'll first arrive at Coffee shop Redeye Roasters,
then visit an art gallery, where Kate works as a manager, to look at Kate's paintings/art pieces!
Then, if people would like to stay for dinner at the close by Irish Pub, The Snug, we could have dinner there, and then head back.
I can do pick and drop from/to Harvard Sq. Logan can do the same from/to Brookline. Please indicate your interest in any/all of these activities in the comments below. 

Public transportation does go here: take the Red Line to Quincy Center, take 220 bus to Hingham at 1pm with arrival at 1:22pm right at restaurant Stars which is across the street from Redeye Roasters. The bus leaves Hingham every hour at 3:25, 4:25, etc.
Or the commuter rail, Greenbush Line, leaves South Station at 12:55 pm and arrives in West Hingham at 1:30pm and it takes @ 15 mins to walk to Redeye Roasters but Kate could pick up at the station. The train leaves Hingham at 2:30, 4:17, 6:52pm.

Thanks and look forward!
results.name: The Third Place

results.description:
Have clothes that no longer fit? Toys and gear your little one has outgrown? Bring them to "hand down" to other parents! Clothing newborn to 2T, baby or momma gear*, and toys are welcome. Any items remaining will be donated to charity.

You are encouraged to bring your baby and partners are welcomed. Bertucci's gives us a semi-private space where we can stand around with our kiddos or sit and enjoy their lunch specials (which includes unlimited rolls and salad).

Are you waiting for the arrival of your little one? Expectant parents are encouraged to join us. Lots of newborn outfits for you to take home. There is FREE parking for Bertucci's across the street by Summer Shack. You don't need to park at the Alewife T station.

*e.g. Bottles, pump parts, breast pads. If you have something larger to pass along, list it in this event in advance so you have a "confirmed" taker and can move the item from one car to the other in the parking lot. Cross-posted from Boston Babies! Aug '15 to Feb '16.

This is a Facebook group for parents and caregivers of children roughly the same age to support each other, share resources, and organize playdates and activities. NOT restricted to parents of children born in this time period - although that's the focus of the group.

Launched in August 2015, this Facebook group quickly become an invaluable resource and incredibly supportive community. We're building on that middle of the night camaraderie by meeting in person.

Robbie Samuels organizes both groups. Join at www.facebook.com/groups/bostonbabies.aug15.to.feb16.
results.name: Boston Babies! Meet & Swap

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

WHAT: ASL Weekly Social
WHEN: EVERY SUNDAY 
TIME: 4:00-6:00PM
WHO: ANYONE is welcome to come by and have a conversation in ASL
WHY: To socialize, have fun, and enjoy chatting in ASL
WHERE:  Potbelly Sandwich Shop behind CVS (on Somerville Ave) 

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. You can easily spot Potbelly Sandwich Shop on side entrance when you arrive at top of escalator at Porter Square Station. If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Sean
results.how_to_find_us: We will be there signing our beautiful language to inspire all of you!
results.name: ASL WEEKLY SOCIAL

results.description:
Give yourself the gift of relaxation and rejuvenation with a wonderful 90 minute gentle yoga and meditation class.

True relaxation is experienced by the body and mind when little or no energy is consumed. It is Nature's way of recharging. Since every action, conscious or unconscious, uses stored energy, relaxation is necessary for good health and peace of mind. Without proper relaxation the body and mind become overworked and inefficient.

When the mind is constantly bombarded by stimuli, it becomes overloaded and exhausted. We may be unaware that we are doing it, but by thinking and worrying we are using up tremendous amounts of energy. The tension put on the mind by worries can use more energy than physical work.

Yoga retrains the body to relax and can calm the mind which leads to inner peace.

This class is for beginners and experienced yogi's.  Chairs are available for those who may need to sit during this class.  Please bring your own yoga mat, water and a blanket or pillow for meditation.
results.name: Gentle Yoga & Meditation - 90 minute class

group.name: The Light Within - Yoga, Reiki, Meditation - Dorchester MA

results.description:
Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle.  An icebreaker will be provided to held facilitate mingling. Then you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: SpeedMeeting-  Singles Ages 39-49 - 1f/3m spots left

We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. results.description:
Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle.  An icebreaker will be provided to held facilitate mingling. Then you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
This is an ongoing weekly (donation only) class for anyone, offering experiential practice in meditation, along with an opportunity to be among others interested in deepening spiritutual practices.  The class provides you with a felt sense of your own divinity; your Higher Self. The meditation, based on Kriya practices,  is partly guided, partly silent. In the guided part we open up to the flow of golden light and energy that is always pouring down to our body/mind/heart and being. Accessing that flow and inviting it to fill us brings a profound level of openness, while washing away limiting thoughts, feelings and beliefs. This higher vibration of unconditional love serves to open our consciousness to new levels of peace, joy and awakening. Bringing the flow of light into the body/mind/heart means we more consciously embody our Light Being, so we are more present, happy, forgiving, peaceful and joyful while in the world.
   After the guided portion we spend time in peaceful silence.  Whether you are an experienced meditator or a beginner, you will love the sweetness and powerful energies of this group. At the end of the class we make time for questions or sharing.  Group meditation is powerful, and it's refreshing to be among fellow travelers!
   Judy also teaches the Sound and Light meditation; a way for you to draw your senses inward to open your spiritual eye and to hear the sounds of your chakras. 
   This practice is non-denominational, appropriate for anyone. 
   Held in a lovely healing space, just walking in will bring you instant peace.  All are welcome.
    You may also want to check out my other Meetup, for a variety of spiritual programs:  http://www.meetup.com/Evolving-Beings/

results.name: Discuss: Cop Town by Karin Slaughter

results.description:
Davis Sedaris is a scream. He has the distinction of being one of the two writers who make me laugh out loud--consistently, no matter where I happen to be. The other is Cervantes. (The rest only mildly tickle my brain, provoking no outer signs of hilarity.) But how does he do it? You tell me!

We'll try to get to the bottom of this by squaring off two of his short stories, both published in the New Yorker. On the surface, they both involve that most mundane of modern pastimes--shopping. But what lies underneath? 

We'll read, impersonate, laugh (out loud!), and excavate:

The Perfect Fit -- about shopping for unwearable clothes in Tokyo...

http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2016/03/28/david-sedaris-shops-for-clothes-in-tokyo


Author, Author? Life among the shopping carts--where he recounts his misadventures during his book tours...

http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2009/03/30/author-author-3


Here's a funny bit from the second story:

"For hours each night I would talk to people, asking pretty much whatever I wanted. The trick, of course, is to match the right person with the right question. Take this young woman I met in Boston a few years back. I’d been signing for almost six hours, and when she finally stepped up to the table my mind went blank. 'When, um . . . When did you last touch a monkey?' I asked.

I expected 'Never,” or 'It’s been years,' but instead she took a step back, saying, 'Oh, can you smell it on me?'"
results.how_to_find_us: At the library, on the left hand-side of entrance
results.name: Mashup: Sedaris vs. Sedaris

group.name: Classic Books: A Book Club for Voracious Readers

results.description:
Have you read a personal growth book that impacted your life?  

Would you like to find a personal growth book that might speak to your life?

Join us for an interactive conversation in which members of our community will share books that inspire and empower them.  Share your favorite book ... and/or leave with a book recommendation.

At this session we will

... share with each other a few books that have changed our lives.

Bring a book and share the Big Ideas that you received from a Book That Changed Your Life.  

(You are also welcome to come and just listen to the Big Ideas.)

Members who share a beloved book can deepen the value they received from the book by describing the Big Ideas and sharing how the book impacted them.   We, who listen, will get ideas of books that just might speak to us.

Come if ... you read a book that you would love to share. 


Come if ... you are curious about ideas that inspire others

Come if ... you want to find a book to read next.


To prepare for this evening... 

• If you have a book that changed your life, what were the ideas that inspired you?  How did these ideas impact your life?

• If you would like, post a link to the book in the comments section below.

Our Leaders This Evening...

… all of us. 

It will be our community, gathering together, to share our own learning.

Links

results.description:
Join The Oldest Established Permanent Floating Community Walk in Cambridge 

For the 200th consecutive Sunday, we will be walking.   Let's join 20 or so others from other walking groups for this walk.

The walk is on, rain or shine.


Since May 2012, there has been a regular walk around Fresh Pond at about an hour before sunset. Frequently, 20-25 walkers turn out for this walk, and you can too. There are a whole bunch of regulars, along with some new people.


Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

We'll all go out for dinner afterwards, somewhere in the neighborhood.
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 4/17 6:30

venue.address_1: Aberdeen Ave & Huron Ave, Cambridge, MA 02138
venue.name: Aberdeen Ave & Huron Ave, Cambridge, MA 02138

results.description:
The oldest, established, permanent floating Community Walk in Cambridge and environs.

Please join the Fresh Pond Community walkers + five other meetup groups for this delightful sunset walk. 

Let's join 20+ walkers and some other walking groups for:

Over 3 years of reliable walking

Please note that this walk does not start at the same place as the other Fresh Pond walk.

We'll go out to dinner at a local pub or chinese restaurant - you can get a decent dinner for under $10.

Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there. We'll be next to the bridge, on the pond side of Huron Ave,at the intersection of Aberdeen Ave.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

Shangri La is located at 149 Belmont Street, Belmont - please let the host know if you're coming, so we can get the right sized table.

results.name: SpeedMeeting- Singles Ages 25-35 - SOLD OUT FOR MEN

results.description:
<a href="http://atwysbostonspeeddate.eventbrite.com/"></a>

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle.  An icebreaker will be provided to held facilitate mingling. Then you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/atwysspeeddating/"></a>

There is ample parking on the street or in the municipal parking lot off Harvard Street.

As promised the first drink (beer) will be FREE and we will provide appetizers! Can't wait to see everyone!
results.name: Let's get together, have a few drinks, socialize, and practice our English!

results.description:
I went to an interesting workshop today at Northeastern University. It was designed for Career Counselors but really is relevant to everyone as we examine our lives and our 'purpose' and our inner selves.

We worked with lots of photographs and drawings ....

So I'd like to do the same on April 17th....Let's all bring 3-5 photos that reflect where we 'were' and where we are 'today' in visual form: e.g./photos from magazines & other printed matter/downloaded images/drawings. This can be in any aspect of your life: work/career, personal life, romantic life, etc.

Let's share our 'collages and discuss how images affect us emotionally and perhaps have us, as some say, 'praying in pictures'....meaning: we see an image, we love it..we think about it, reflect on it, cry or laugh....and we KEEP it...because we want THAT..we want THAT to happen in our lives. 

Why are images so powerful? Or are they?

I know this again is a HUGE topic, but let's discuss and share it over dinner & drinks.

See you then!
Bev
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for Beverly's Table
results.name: Soul Collage: What's Your Purpose?

venue.name: Watertown Center for Healing Arts (Charles River Room)

results.description:
When you go to a meetup event (or any kind of social gathering), aren't you secretly hoping to meet someone that you really connect with?  Someone you can't wait to see again, and they can't wait to see you as well?

There's nothing like that magical feeling that washes over you when you go home thinking, "Wow... I met someone special tonight!" A lot of people think that these experiences are rare, but it's not true.  This can happen to you regularly once you know how to really connect with someone you're interested in.

And that's what I want to teach you in a very unique workshop unlike anything you've seen before!

************************************************* 
HERE'S WHAT YOU'LL DISCOVER: 
*************************************************

* Word-for-word what to say after you say hello in order to keep the conversation going effortlessly.  Never get stuck for what to say again!

* Revealed: An advanced conversational technique that instantly makes people feel curious about you.  Don't be surprised if people start telling you how fascinating you are once you begin integrating this technique into the way you normally speak.  The best part?  It's totally natural and easy to do.

* The Verbal Can Opener Technique - A surprisingly simple method that instantly gets people to open to you, even if you just met them. Once you understand this, you can build deep friendships & relationships with anyone you want.

* My best technique for making someone feel like you really "get" them.  This goes way beyond boring small talk, and creates an instant bond that they will value and appreciate.  What I love about this technique is that it's surprisingly easy to use, even if you're shy.  Anyone can do it!

* The Magic Checkmark Method - Use this technique to answer questions about yourself in a way that others find fascinating.  This unique way of answering questions about yourself actually makes others want to get to know you better.  Many students have told me that this is by far their favorite thing they learned from my workshops.

* The Instant Heart Connection Technique - This one is pure magic.  It quickly and easily boosts the amount of connection someone feels with you in the moment.  The best part?  It takes only 3 seconds to use.  You've never heard this one before, I guarantee it!

* How to end a conversation that will leave people feeling good about you and about themselves. If you've ever wanted to end a conversation with someone, but were worried about offending or upsetting them, then this is perfect for you.

* The 4 connection killing mistakes that almost everyone makes.  I'll show you what they are, how to avoid them, and what to do instead.  

* And much more!

************************************************* 
WANT TO JOIN US?  HERE'S HOW: 
*************************************************

Where is it? The seminar is conveniently located at the Watertown Center For Healing Arts which is a beautiful facility for an event like this. 

What time? Please plan on arriving by 6:45pm so you have time to settle in and meet the other members. We start promptly at 7:00pm and go until 9:30pm (with a break in the middle).  There are plenty of bus lines that go to the center, and there is also lots of parking both on the street and in a big parking lot near the center.  The bottom of this page has details: 

http://watertowncenter.net/directions-2/ 

How much? Cheap.  If you took a class like this through an adult education center, you'd easily pay more than $50 to attend, and that's assuming there even is a class that could offer you all this, which there isn't.  
  No other class offers you this kind of cutting edge training that's based in real world results.  This stuff WORKS!  What if one small change is all it takes to immediately and effortlessly begin attracting high-quality friends and dating prospects into your life?  I've seen it happen many times in this group, and it can happen for you too. 

So how much? Because I want to help as many people as I can, I've decided to keep the price very affordable so that anyone who wants to come will be able to.  The cost for this event is only $20, which is very low considering the quality of training that you'll be getting. 

Think about it... that's 67 cents a day for a month.  What else do you spend 67 cents on every day that makes no difference in your social life (or love life) whatsoever? I promise that this will be well worth your time. 

How big is the class? In order to make sure I can personally help as many people as possible, the class is limited to the first 50 people who RSVP.  This is not a lecture.  We are going to be moving around and doing lots of fun exercises, so I have to limit the size.  I'm listing this event in 6 different meetup groups, so there are literally more than 14,500 people seeing this listing.  

Go ahead and put in your RSVP right now in order to secure your spot.  I'm looking forward to seeing you there. 

Warmly, 
Jason 

P.S. - Take down my cell number in case you have any questions about the event or if you get lost. The venue is extremely easy to find, so you should have no problems, but just in case, my cell is[masked]-8871.
results.how_to_find_us: Go through the door and go up the stairs.  You'll see the registration table at the top.

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers, 


Let's enjoy a film from the 15th Annual Belmont Word Film Festival.  This event will showcase French/Belgium film, The White Knights (Les Chevaliers Blancs) (2015) (112 minutes) (French, English, Arabic with English subtitles), directed by Joachim Lafosse.  

My dear friend, Maria, and fellow Boston Culture Lover member is on the committee for this festival.  I know that she and the committee work really hard in selecting the best films.  All the films that I have seen from this festival have been excellent!


This film is just one of many in the festival, for the complete schedule, go to www.belmontworldfilm.org/

The film starts at 7:30 pm, however I would like to meet the group at 7 pm at the lobby, so we can meet and greet before the film. 

Here is a brief description of the film:


Vincent Lindon (featured in Welcome, shown in 2011) plays the head of an NGO in the midst of rescuing 300 orphans, victims of the Chadian civil war, to be brought to French adoption applicants. Immersed in the brutal reality of a country at war, the NGO members start losing their convictions and are faced with the limits of humanitarian intervention. Inspired by the events of the Zoé's Ark controversy in 2007. Official selection at the Toronto International Film Festival. </a>

<a href="http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/white-knights-les-chevaliers-blancs-818922">http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/white-knights-les-chevaliers-blancs-818922


http://www.imdb.com/title/tt3597510/


To view the trailer, go to https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IJgsZt-82fo


To avoid the risk of this event selling out, I always recommend that you purchase your tickets in advance, you may purchase your ticket at http://www.ticketor.com/belmontworldfilm/tickets/casa-grande-4611?treferrer=Web 


* General admission is $11 and admission students and seniors is $9. 


Please only reserve "yes" if you are planning to attending.


For events to be successful and carefree, it is important for me to know who and how many people to expect. If you are a "no-show", a courteous message is expected.  A consistent of history of no-shows and lack of courtesy may cause members to be removed from the group. 


If you reserve "yes" and your plans change, no problem, I only ask that you change your reservation to "not attending".  

I will reconfirm details as we get closer to date of the event.


I look forward to enjoying this event with the group. 

Joana
results.how_to_find_us: 7 pm in the lobby
results.name: The White Knights (Les Chevaliers Blancs) - Belmont World Festival

results.description:
Join us for a night of contra dancing, Sunday April 17th, at 1950 Massachusetts Avenue, Cambridge MA.

Caller: Frannie Marr
Music: Brendan Taaffe, Kelsey Wells, Donal Sheets Dance 7:30-10:30pm
Dessert Potluck during the break -- Bring something to share! **Please feel free to join us at 7:00 for a beginner's lesson if you're fresh to contra dancing! $5-12 sliding scale, as you're able. Bring someone new to Contra to the intro session and you both get passes for free admission to a future dance! Share the love. Public Transportation (recommended): We are across the street from the Porter Square Red Line stop.

Parking: Free street parking (meters and residential are open to all on Sundays). Don't park in the Shaw's parking lot because they tow.

See you there!

results.description:
Join us for a Evening of Fine Arts on Sunday, April 17th!

Challenge the Stats is a concert that highlights African American artists in the city of Boston and challenges the underrepresentation of minorities in the fine arts. The performance will celebrate African American composers, musicians, filmmakers, dancers, and spoken word artists. The evening includes musical and dance performances, moving film presentations and a conversation about racial adversities in the fine arts. Challenge The Stats takes place on April 17th at 7:30 p.m. at Northeastern University's Fenway Center (77 St. Stephen Street, Boston, MA 02115). Doors open at 7pm. Street parking is available. A reception follows the concert.

Free tickets can be reserved at: www.angelicahairston.com/challengethestats

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TR4Q6LfehSc

We can't wait to meet you!
Angelica & Barbie (co-host)
results.name: Challenge the Stats | Evening of Fine Arts & Reception

results.description:
Challenge the Stats is a concert that highlights some of the top African American artists in the city of Boston and challenges the vast underrepresentation of minorities in the fine arts. The performance will celebrate African American composers, musicians, filmmakers, dancers, and spoken word artists from Northeastern University, Boston University, Boston Conservatory, Berklee College of Music and the New England Conservatory of Music. The concert includes musical and dance performances, moving film presentations and a conversation about racial adversities in the fine arts. Challenge The Stats takes place on April 17th at 7:30 p.m. at Northeastern University's Fenway Center (77 St. Stephen Street, Boston, MA 02115).

Free tickets can be reserved at: www.angelicahairston.com/challengethestats

results.description:
Hi Folks, I thought I'd post the info for the midnight ride on here. It's a fun ride the night before the Marathon. There are different routes but my plan is to start at the finish, ride to Hopkinton, then ride back. It's around 52 miles in total. There is no speed, and the ride has many varying speed riders. Last years was deathly cold, wear layers. If you have any questions, post them here on on the facebook group. The 8th Annual Boston Midnight Marathon Bike Ride: a self-guided marathon on wheels...at midnight! More details to come closer to the ride date.
Become a fan of the ride here: https://www.facebook.com/midnightmarathonbikeride/
Join discussions and find riding buddies in the community group here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/381020462038802/

results.description:
As the weather starts to get warmer, Project Freerun begins it Parkour 101 City Clinics.

These clinics are designed to introduce those who are beginners or novices at movement to Parkour, The Art of Movement. The classes run in 6 week series to focus each week on a new skill set and area of Parkour Training. This first session on April 17 is a introductory class to provide foundational techniques and a basci knowledge of safety in order to quickly progress thorugh our Spring 1 Series (6 Weeks held every Sunday hereafter)
The cost of April 17 is $10, and going forward the 6 week series is $50 if you would rather pay beforehand. FAQs
------
What is Parkour?

Parkour is a training discipline using movement that developed from military obstacle course training. Practitioners aim to get from one point to another in a complex environment, without assistive equipment and in the fastest and most efficient way possible.

Parkour includes running, climbing, swinging, vaulting, jumping, rolling, quadrupedal movement, and other movements as deemed most suitable for the situation. Parkour's development from military training gives it some aspects of a non-combative martial art.

What if I've never done anything like Parkour before? This class, Parkour 101, is a introductory level class. We will be focusing more on learning how to move our body, understand our limits and get a solid understanding of how to train safe rather than jumping straight into super-high level flips and jumps. What if I'm a gymnast/marine/stuntman/etc? I don't want to be bored.

Our program prides itself on scaling classes to each and every student. With something like Parkour there are many levels and progressions to each movement. It's very common to in the same class have one student working on perfecting their roll, and on the other side of the room have another student practicing very high-level acrobatics. They both come from the same foundation, but are scaled to each practitioners skill level. What do I need to bring/prepare?

The great thing about Parkour is its accessibility. You really only need a good pair of shoes. We recommend a shoe that is made for urban running (no aggressive treads, a smoother sole lightweight). Think hiking boots, crocs, skate shoes are all no-nos. Other than that, dress appropriately for activity. Shorts, sweats, t-shirts are all good here. Jeans are normally not the best choice. We highly recommend bringing water, snacks and a form of transportation (bike, longboard, potentially train fare)
We will be charging a $10 per class fee to start here, and for the 1 hour 15 minute class we think this isn't too ridiculous. We accept cash or card day of. Anything else?

These jams will be run outdoors, and with existing architecture. While we won't be getting into anything crazy, injuries are to be expected. Scrapes happen. We will have first aid available, but make sure you are thinking clearly and in your limits before training! We are available to answer all questions, but I hope to see a whole bunch of you out this week!! Be sure to check us out on:

https://www.facebook.com/ParkourAndTricking
https://instagram.com/projectfreerun
http://www.projectfreerun.com/
results.name: [Boston] Parkour 101 Spring Classes

results.description:
Each year in mid-April, thousands of people flock to historic Lexington and Concord and Minute Man National Historical Park to celebrate Patriots' Day. Patriots' Day is a special Massachusetts State holiday commemorating the opening battle of the American Revolutionary War, April 19, 1775.

Lexington Battle Reenactment
Lexington Green
5:30 a.m.
The Town of Lexington celebrates the first shots of the American Revolution with a reenactment of the early-morning engagement between the town's militia and the Briitish regulars.

Commemoration of the North Bridge Fight, and Concord Parade

North Bridge, Concord  8:45 a.m.

British and Colonial reenactors will commemorate the "Shot heard round the world" with a dramatic re-staging of the North Bridge fight featuring marching and musket fire. The Concord Parade will arrive at North Bridge around 9:30 a.m. with ceremonies featuring minute man companies, British reenactors and music groups. NOTE: all of the roads in the center of town are closed to vehicles beginning at 8:30 a.m.

a map of the park at this link:

Minute Man National Historical Park (U.S. National Park Service)

I will get more info on this as the date gets closer.  There is much to see and do in Minuet Man State Park.  I am going to scout it out ahead of time to see the distance between these two battles and if it is walkable, since the roads are closed.  Any volunteers to scout it out with me????
results.name: 241 st ANNIVERSARY of the BATTLE of LEXINGTON AND CONCORD

results.description:
This is a friendly monthly reminder to contribute $11 yearly to help us pay off the yearly Meetup Group fee and additional cost to run the group and keep the group going. This is more for member's information and is not meant to sound that I am angry. Also, note that  Biagio is NOT getting rich from the group fees.  This is a YEARLY fee and NOT a monthly fee.

I wanted to address any crazy rumors and incorrect assumptions that I am getting rich from Meetup. These assumptions are based on having ALL 9,000 members paying the $10 a member fee which would equal $90,000, but that is 100% incorrect. I am not making $90,000 a year for this group!

So please let me clarify less than 1% of the group’ members actually pay the $11 yearly Voluntarily Donation. Out of that $11 PayPal take their cut so I only get  $10 per member. I barley take in $200 a year and that is NOT enough cover the yearly Meetup fees and the other Meetup expense like printing out Meetup materials, supplies for the group, batteries, games, Meetup business cards, etc. Over the past 6 years I've acquired over $2000 of debt to run this group and cover Meetup expenses. So it is time to understand the truth and stop making assumption.

Biagio is pretty Poor and Not rich. Luckily, there hasn’t yet been a need for me to start to begging for money on the side of the street……….. yet!

I am now paying Meetup a $200  fee  every year to run the group. In 2015 we have only collected $150 from members for the Meetup Group Fee so far, and we have not paid off the 2014 debt which is over $500 now. If we cannot get members to pay off the 2014 and 2015 debt  then I’m just going to let the group shut down due to lack of  funding when the 2016 payment is due.

Don’t forget,  I pay for batteries, supplies,  printouts,  signs, games, stands  etc. etc. to run this group its over $700 a year,  which includes the $200 a year Meetup fee!

So please be informed and realize what it takes to run a group this large. Oh and add to that I spend 30+ hours every week of my own time running the group which I get paid $0 for.

Please help keep the group going. Don’t let not giving $11 a year, every year stop all the fun. Oh and you don’t have to pay the $11 online you can pay the $10 in person or e-mail me to pay by check.

If you want to pay online Meetup has shut down the Amazon payment feature so you can now pay using Paypal and pay $11 to my PayPal account using e-mail address which is [masked]

</a>

<a href="mailto:[masked]">===================================

With PayPal, you can send money to anyone with an email address.

Here’s how to send money:

Log in to your PayPal account.


Click Send money to a friend at the top of the page.

Type the email address or mobile number to whom you are sending money, and the amount being sent. In this case its [masked]

Click Next.  

Review and confirm the information on the screen and click Send.

=======================================

Thanks and let’s keep the fun gong!

Biagio

results.description:
Don your tri-corner hat and join me on Patriots Day morning for a short paddle down the Concord River and under the historic Old North Bridge. We'll enjoy re-enactment ceremonies and a commemoration of the battle for the bridge before being treated to the parade arrival.

Note - this will be an extended period of sitting in place. Those looking to actually paddle the river instead of watching the events will have the option to organize a subgroup to get some milage.
Details about the full Patriots Day weekend are here: http://www.nps.gov/mima/patriots-day.htm

Paddle details - Could be cold water conditions. Dress appropriately! We may be stationary for some time while re-enactments and speeches are in progress.

As of now, this is a level-1 paddle open to all paddlers/kayaks. As the paddle date comes closer, winter runoff and conditions on the Concord River may change. Flooding and fast current may elevate this to a level-2.

Butts in boats NLT 8am to be at the Old North Bridge by 830 for the start of re-enactments.

Parking will not be allowed on the boat ramp, bridge, or parade route. All vehicles will need to be parked along Lowell Road north of Liberty Street. (A couple hundred feet walk - no biggie)

Again - details will change as the date draws near. Stay tuned!

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO: Hold harmless, and indemnify the organizers and their relations and heirs, and all members and participants of the Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment. As organizers we make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing. This is not a guided tour. In the interest of safety, consuming alcohol before or during any Casual Kayakers event is not allowed. Wearing of Lifejackets (PFD's) is required when paddling with this group.
results.name: Patriots Day Parade Paddle

results.description:
The Framingham Drum Circle MEETUP along with The Boston Drum Circle MEETUP group is invited to join the amazing Annual...

DRUMMING FOR THE MARATHON!

This is the 16th year we've been drumming at the start of Heartbreak Hill. Organized by your Meetup leader, John Tracy and drummers from DrumConnection. There are usually about fifty or more drummers.

Runners say it's the highlight of their trip. Some even like us so much they stop a moment to try the drums.

Onlookers smile, police and military wave, TV cameras pass by, children dance.

Really special! Don't miss it!

Please RSVP so we know how to set up the space.

No drums? We will have a few extra, and people will share.

Click for a video of us: VIDEO

____________________________________________________

PLEASE CHECK THESE DETAILS CAREFULLY.

THEY ARE CRITICAL!

What you need so you can get there without stress or parking problems, and be there right at the drumming spot, with an easy route out for when you leave.

IMPORTANT SECURITY REQUIREMENTS

This is an important year for us to be there to show community support and support the runners. If you have been here before you KNOW how much it matters to have us with them!

We have spent much time with security officials, the BAA and local police about how to manage things this year. Now, due to the attacks in Paris and Belgium, security remains very high and we need to minimize stress to security people and remain welcome to drum for future years.

• DRUM BAGS - while we ARE relaxing the 'drum bag and backpack restriction' this year,  BE AWARE that if you look suspicious, you may be asked to open your bags. • If you can manage, do not bring a drum bag.  At the site, flatten any bags on the ground to minimize any threats that may stress authorities and public. If it looks like it might rain bring a plastic trash bag in your pocket for rain cover if needed. Always a good idea.

• CAREFULLY review maps of the area. This year Chestnut St. will be blocked at 7:30 AM. At the rte 9 side, at Beacon, about 1/4 mile from the intersection. On the other side of Commonwealth Ave. Chestnut St. will be blocked about one block from Commonwealth. Police say you can park up to 60 ft. of Commonwealth Ave (rt 30). Our advice is to get on the local streets off Beacon and navigate to a side road close to our spot. On the other side, there are local roads off Chestnut at point it is closed, or shortly before.

• We RESPECT the community. This means we play for awhile, then take breaks, where everyone is quiet. Nonstop loud drumming (drums are loud) can be annoying and stressful. Taking breaks makes it better, and we remain welcome for future years, and make it easier for officials. 

WHERE:

We set aside a private area near the corner of Chestnut St. and Commonwelth Ave. (rte 30) in Newton.

One good approach is to enter local roads near Chestnut St. at Beacon St.

WHEN:

Get there early and avoid traffic and get through to park. Worth the effort. Yes. I know.

The first group, wheelchairs, arrive at our spot at about 10:17

Plan to be there around 9:00!! (if you can)

Actually, anytime is fine but if you beat the traffic life is better and you get a closer parking spot. I get there really early, find a nice close parking spot, relax, maybe snooze or read, then set up our area.

MBTA: You can avoid parking, and take the GREEN LINE to the WABAN stop. This is the last one before end at Riverside terminal. It is a walk of about 15 minutes to the drumming spot.

What to Bring:

A drum. No drum? This is a long event, and people are confortable stopping awhile and letting others borrow their drums.. Yeah - bring non-drumming friends... it's always a FUN celebration.

A folding chair. The cheap metal ones are best, and bring a cushion. The canvas chairs are too low and at wrong angle for comfortable drumming.

Water. Snacks.

Maybe suntan lotion (I hope! .. This day often surprises. Can be cold and gray, can be very hot and sunny)

Facilities:

Yes, there are porta potties.

RAIN?? ... Drums don't like rain. If it rains steadily we will not be there.

But remember if there is a chance of rain, have a plastic trash bag in pocket to protect your drum.

SUN?? ... Some years there is a LOT of sun. Good idea to bring a hat and sunscreen. And water!!

WHAT WE DO -  SIMPLE  RULES:

1) For the best experience, so we sound good and are welcomed by the onlookers, we should mostly play simple rhythms so everyone can connect. We need to be CLEAR and simple.  Fine to add an occasional solo if it is clear and fits with the rhythm.

2) Those who can lead know who they are - and are welcome to take responsibility.

3) Essential to STOP for periods of quiet. No drumming.  We have found it is important for the crowds.  Non-stop drumming is an irritant, people complain, we risk losing the privilege. SO - when we stop - everyone stops.  Yes - if a key runner or group comes by and waves, when we are quiet, we could do a quick roll, but then return to being quiet.

_______________________________________

ANY questions - call me anytime  [masked]-2962. And since I may be away a few days, call Alan anytime[masked]-6080.

John Tracy
results.how_to_find_us: At 9AM we will be getting set up. Follow the Directions to 1384 Comm Ave Newton. Please park on side streets either on the RT 9 side or the North side of Comm Ave so you can get home faster, or to work.
results.name: Drumming for the Boston Marathon April 18, 2016

results.description:
Join Musical Storytelling Fellows from NEC's Community Performances and Partnerships Program for a fun-filled morning of music and stories. Free and all ages welcome!

The program will include new and familiar favorites such as Dr. Seuss' "Oh, the Places You'll Go", Traditional Chinese Folk Tale "The Stream Flows", Eric Carle's "The Very Quiet Cricket", and Maurice Sendak's "Where the Wild Things Are"

http://necmusic.edu/event/15813

Location: Williams Hall is NEC’s main solo recital hall, as well as the venue for masterclasses and studio classes. The seating capacity of the hall's floor and balcony is 220, but its lack of fixed floor seating also allows it to be used for large ensemble rehearsals, meetings, and other functions. Campus Map: http://necmusic.edu/campus-map

Tickets: NEC's FREE concerts do not require a ticket, unless stated in concert listing. Unreserved seating is available on a first-come, first-served basis. Doors open 30 minutes prior to the concert's start time.
results.name: FREE Musical Storytelling Showcase @ NEC's Williams Hall

results.description: Marathon Monday Heartbreak Hill April 18th. Meetup will be at the corner of Hammond Street and Commonwealth Avenue at 10:30 a.m. . Great curbside location with fewer spectators and not a mob scene like Boston. This location has food vendors porta-potties and even a few House Parties. Often Heartbreak Hill is a turning point for many runners and many times the race has been won on Heartbreak Hill not at the finish line. There is plenty of on-street parking around the Hammond Street area. For those taking MBTA to Boston College can walk down Heartbreak Hill a short distance to meet on Hammond Street. Rain will cancel this meet up but not the marathon. Be sure to dress comfortably pack some bottled water and some snacks if needed along with your equipment.
