results.description:
We all go to meetups, but have you ever thought to run your own meetup?


Do you want to know how you can make it a success?


Do you want to know how you can use your meetup to grow your business?


Join us on this content packed webinar and learn from Brady Patterson how you can quickly grow your business by building a large networking group.

Register for this FREE webinar at:

http://app.webinarjam.net/register/3004/762fe621b2


In this presentation you will discover:


1- How to build an active and fast growing meetup group


2- How to find amazing speakers and expand your personal network


3- How to position yourself as an authority in your field in a short time by running a networking group


You've probably been to many meetups, now see behind the scenes of running a successful networking group.

Register for this FREE webinar at:

http://app.webinarjam.net/register/3004/762fe621b2


Brady Patterson is the Event Organizer Coordinator of Entrepreneurs International Network, a fast growing network for entrepreneurs to learn, network and grow with 27 local chapters across the globe from Los Angeles, CA to Sydney, Australia.


Entrepreneurs International Network (EIN) is entirely volunteer run but the local organizers get massive benefit of being positioned as the "Go To Expert" in the field as well as being known as infulential people in their area. The founder of EIN, Iman Aghay built his business absolutely from scratch by creating one of the fastest growing business networks in the world and ever since has been working and consulting with other networks to help them grow faster and attract more qualified members.


In this presentation Brady Patterson is going to share with you exactly every step to:


1- find amazing speakers


2- market your events properly to attract great audience members


3- promote your business gently so it doesn’t repel members yet attract qualified clients to you


4- DOs and DON’Ts of organizing a networking group


5- where to start and how to succeed fast

Wanna try us out? Come join us at our water training sessions! No prior experience necessary. 

• First two practices are $10 (The $10 can go towards the full membership of $110 for the rest of the season). Pay via Paypal ("Boston 1 - Join us") or venmo (@boston1dboat).</a>

• Also you will not be allowed on the boats if you do not sign the waiver: <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Ll2NR3MZbV3O7ZrmPdZsCbKRaC_G8KKa7lwBUlC59Pk/viewform?c=0&w=1">"Boston 1 e-waiver" 

• Make sure to check our Facebook,</a><a href="http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook">http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook for practice announcements and cancellations -- especially in the early and later parts of season with potentially colder night practices. 

Weekly practices are every Monday, Wednesday and Saturday unless a race is scheduled or practice is cancelled.

Mon & Wed: 5:45pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab. 
Sat: 10:45am - 1pm, meet 10.45am on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab.

Optional dinner/lunch or social activity afterwards!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather and water! Be prepared to get wet!

• Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards. 

• Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended. 

• Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen. Expensive glasses or sunglasses are not recommended. 

All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locked locker provided on-site. Please bring as little as possible to practice as space is limited.

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in Twitter, Facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook

Parking: Channelside Parking at 284 A Street. Enter at 29-41 Necco Street, off Melcher Street. Weekend $5 flat rate. Weekdays $8 flat rate (in after 3pm). More details can be found here: http://bit.ly/1Nxv1lw.

Restroom: Do not use the restrooms in the Barking Crab, use the public restrooms near the Daily Catch

Public Transport: Closest T stop is South Station on the red line.

Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Featured Speaker and Topic: Slava Kokaev (@SlavaKokaev) will present on Introduction to Stream Analytics in Azure.

• 6:00 PM - Gather, pizza, socialize

• 6:30 PM - Boston Azure Theater: Azure-relevant highlights from BUILD 2016


• 7:00 PM - Featured talk: Slava Kokaev will present on Introduction to Stream Analytics in Azure

• 8:25 PM - Announcements

• 8:30 PM - DONE. Perhaps get a beer.

Featured Talk: Azure Stream Analytics (ASA) is a fully managed, cost effective real-time event processing engine that helps to unlock deep insights from data. Stream Analytics makes it easy to set up real-time analytic computations on data streaming from devices, sensors, web sites, social media, applications, infrastructure systems, and more.

In this introductory session to ASA, you will learn how to create stream processing logic to gather data from Internet of Things (IoT) devices. We will use a real-world, Internet of Things (IoT) use-case to demonstrate how to build your solution quickly and economically.

We are going to learn how to:


• Setup and Configure ASA in Azure Portal.

• Create Azure Event Hub to stream the data.

• Create ASA Jobs to process IoT steaming data.

• Use the Stream Analytics query language.

• Consume and save processed data.
  About Slava: Slava Kokaev, Lead Business Intelligence Architect at Lockheed Martin, Mentor, Speaker and Boston Microsoft Business Intelligence User Group Leader specializing in Business Intelligence Systems, Data Analytics and Security Intelligence.

-------------

Event: Boston Azure April Meeting


Date:[masked]

Time: 6:00pm

Set Up: theatre 

Room Location: 1MEM - 1st Sampson/Paul

Number of People: 50
results.name: Introduction to Azure Stream Analytics by Slava Kokaev

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace.

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising. 

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

results.description:
What the experience of drumming offers:

* A peak experience that bonds all who share it
* An atmosphere of truth, support, and harmony
* Techniques to reduce tension, worry, and stress
* A tribal celebration in an indigenous tradition
* Open heart and mind to awareness of spirit.

Mamadou teaches the importance of the drum in the African culture to the community as a mode of communication and in the daily life.

West african drumming is not just music, but an experience of the heart, mind, and spirit. It evokes self-discovery, spiritual renewal, joy for life, and a deep sense of community.

Each class is $10 per person.
results.why:
Mamadou has been teaching African drum in the North Shore area for over 10 years. He has an inherent talent for sharing his abilities with others. Let him teach you how to feel the rhythms of West Africa.

Plus, its a lot of fun :)

results.description:
We'll join in for the SURJ Boston monthly whole-group meeting. 


**If this is your first meeting with SURJ Boston, please try to go at 5:30 pm for orientation (if you can), and to catch up with what's been happening.**


From the SURJ Boston Facebook page:

Showing Up for Racial Justice- Boston is a volunteer run project of Community Change Inc and a chapter of a national network of groups and individuals organizing white people for racial justice.
SURJ Boston focuses on: Building community with people and organizations in the Boston area working to end racism; Supporting and taking action to end racism/White Supremacy; Welcoming people new to racial justice work and/or new to the Boston area; and Exploring the larger Strategy of anti-racist organizing.

Accessibility: SEIU Local 615 is accessible by elevator.  The outside door may not have a mechanism to let people in easily.  Please be in touch about particular accessibility needs.
results.name: Attend SURJ Boston Meeting**

We will be meeting at Clover Food Labs in Cambridge for our HackNight. This is the one in the heart of Kendal/MIT in Cambridge, so it is T accessible. Also, if you are driving there is free parking in the Hayward Lot after 5pm, see you tonight!

Bring any Android project you like, weather you are currently working on a side project as a hobby, have a new startup idea you want to work on, or just getting started on some tuts, and interested in learning more about Android in general! This is a good way to learn among your peers, network, meet some new people, get some help or feedback, and maybe even collaborate on a project together! So bring your energy, passion to learn, and most importantly bring your selves. All skill levels welcomed...

1.) BE SURE TO DOWNLOAD ANDROID STUDIO

3.) SIGN UP FOR OUR VIRTUAL STUDY IN JAVA (this has already started, yet there is still time to join)

Don't forget to follow us @AndroidBoston on Twitter, and share with your friends that you are attending #ABHN41!

results.description:
Returning for the 2016 season, GBNEMBA is hosting a Monday night ride designed specifically for new and novice MTB'rs. Come learn the basic skills to ride singletrack! We will be teaching bike handling, shifting, body position, basic trail skills and basic trailside bike maintenance in a relaxed and supportive setting.

What to bring:
1. Bike with fat tires (2" or over)
2. Helmet (required)
3. Shoes suitable for riding your bike (no sandals, flip-flops or other open-toed shoes)
4. Water
5. You!

Instruction will be by GBNEMBA's experienced Ride Guides in a supportive, fun environment.

Ride format will *always* be no-drop, very casual pace (Note: this is not a recovery or rest ride for your experienced MTBrs - this is an instructional ride format for new riders). We'll have plenty of opportunity to practice what we learn as we go along! Please be ready to ride by 6:00pm, ride will leave the lot by 6:15pm.

http://www.nemba.org/rides/gbnemba-beginnernovice-ride

results.description:
You voted and want to revist Cafe Asiana in South Braintree Square as part of walk down memory lane as we approach our 10th Anniversary this summer! Cafe Asiana is a cozy Thai/Asian restaurant which has become a favorite among Thai lovers in the SSDOMG members and locals alike.  With appetizers ranging from $4-$8 and entrees ranging from $7-$14 this makes this reasonably priced restaurant one worth trying regardless of whether you love Thai or have not yet tried it!

The first and only time the SSDOMG has dined at Cafe Asiana was back in September of 2007!  Click on the following link to be taken to the event page to see what members had to say about their dining experience.  http://www.meetup.com/ssdomg/events/6272779/

Please Note: This event was originally scheduled for March but has was cancelled and has since been rescheduled for Monday, April 18th, which is Patriot's Day.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Restaurant Revisit #1: Cafe Asiana!

Monday, April 18th @ 6:30pm
Cafe Asiana
25 Pearl Street
South Braintree Square
Braintree, MA 02184
[masked]

Meeting Place: In front of Cafe Asiana. If you arrive after we are seated please meet us at our table.  If it's inclement weather please meet inside the front door no earlier than 6:25.  (This restaurant and entryway is small so please meet outside. If it's raining then we will meet inside the Lobby @ 6:25 or after or at our table.)  Note: The reservation is under my name only!!

Event Host(s)/Organizer(s): Angela ~ Note: The reservation is under my name only!

Event Fee: [Current] Annual Members - FREE, Members - $2 each; $5 to become an Annual Member

Min/Max: Minimum of 5 members 72 hours prior, maximum of 10.

Guests: None for this event as the venue is small; since many members enjoy Thai we want to make sure we have ample room at the table for our members.

RSVP Deadline: Monday, April 18th @ 2pm. Any changes made after this time may not be seen by an Event Organizer prior to the event and are subject to our Group's No-Show Policy.

No-Show Policy on Membership Information Page: (Please click on the following link to be taken directly to the page.)

http://www.meetup.com/ssdomg/pages/Membership_Information/

Cash Only Policy: Please bring cash! Paying for all of our meals in cash has been SSDOMG'S policy for over three years. It allows us to avoid the confusion of having the waitstaff run multiple credit card slips and generally helps to keep things simpler for everyone.

Inclement Weather: Based on the weather forecast we should be OK.  There may be a passing shower but we will meet rain or shine.  Please see our Weather policy on the About page (scroll to the bottom and click on "Weather").

Please see the Pages tab for more information about the SSDOMG's policies and procedures which help ensure a smoother, relaxed, fun dining experience for everyone.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Directions: (Angela can pretty much get you from anywhere. If you feel directions are needed from another direction please email her directly and she will update directions accordingly.)

Overview: Cafe Asiana is located @ 25 Pearl Street directly across the street from McDonald's and directly in front of Rite Aid (formerly Brooks Pharmacy). 

From Route 3: Take Exit 17/Union Street. Exit out of the Rotary heading towards South Braintree keeping the Motel 6 on your left. Take a left at the first light onto Ivory Street, keeping the T on your right. Go straight thru the 1st light. Take a right at the 2nd light onto Pearl Street. Go straight through the first light. Go under the overpass and up the hill. Once you get to the top of the hill Cafe Asiana will be on your left across from McDonald's. 

You may also want to try maps.google.com or mapquest.com for an aerial map and/or door-to-door directions.

Parking: They have a tiny parking lot and limited on-street parking in front of the restaurant. The good news is there is plenty of on-street parking in South Braintree Square as well as a Municipal Parking lot diagonally across the street to the left (when looking at) of Southside Tavern (which was The Farragut House when we first dined here in 2007).  All parking is free.

Reminder: All of SSDOMG's events are for adults 21+ only.

PLEASE RSVP SO WE CAN CONFIRM WE HAVE NUMBERS FOR THE GAME.

6:00-6:15 pm - Warm up & practice, we'll work on some throws, passes & catches.

6:15 pm - Game starts.

General guidelines: Dress accordingly. Bring a white & dark shirt so we can easily divide into 2 teams. Have plenty of water. Sunscreen on a sunny day. Stretch & warm up. We'll provide discs and cones.

Weather: Rain in New England is unpredictable. We will send out a final notice one hour before start time if cancellation is necessary.

RSVP: Very helpful as this is how we contact you in case of game changes & cancellations.

About: Playing Ultimate is all about good sportsmanship, respect, and gracefulness on the field.  Fun & having a good time is a must above anything else. It's an easy game to pick up & we keep the rules minimal. No zones, no stall count, no scores, and players self-officiate on the field.  Open to all levels of players.  Beginners welcome.

Warning: Excessive fun & comradery developed from playing Ultimate may become addicting.

If you are brand new to Kizomba then this is the time to get started. if you're not too sure about it then this is the time to find out for yourself. If you've been to a few classes then this is what you've been waiting for. Come find out why everyone is so excited.

results.description:
Climbing MeetUp at MetroRock Gym in Everett. Toprope, sport leading, and bouldering available, including some tall walls up to 55 feet. Whether you're a new or experienced climber, join us for a fun and solid workout! We usually have people at all levels. Gym meetups are also a great way to make more friends for outdoor climbing. Plus Mondays are Ladies' Night: discounted admission. If you'd like to lead climb, don't forget to bring your rope :)

*** If you are new to MetroRock Gym and/or climbing, please see the FAQ below. ***

Please RSVP if possible; helps everyone to know others are coming.  Meet at the picnic table near bouldering area (usually the round one, furthest from the cubbies, if available) at 7 PM.  We usually wait a few minutes for people to show and make introductions, but if you arrive later and miss us at the table,  check the small whiteboard near the bathrooms and water fountain, for a description of what the Event Host (see RSVP list) is wearing that day, and come find us on the walls.  Don't be shy, make an effort to ask around and find the group; we're all friendly.  We usually climb until 9-9:30-ish, but if you'd like to secure partner(s) who can come earlier or stay later, feel free to post to the comment section below.

(NOTE: In the very rare case the Event Host doesn't arrive by 7, assume major traffic jam or other catastrophy, ask others nearby to find the group, make introductions, and go climb).

Full-access Day Pass:  $22.  Students, Military or Bouldering-Only Pass:  $18.  Mondays are Ladies Night:  Women's Pass $14 after 3 PM & also special class pricing.

For membership, gear rentals, and other programs and pricing available, or for directions, check the gym website:  http://www.metrorock.com/

Frequently Asked Questions for Newbies:

Q) How do I get to the gym?

A) See website for directions: http://www.metrorock.com/ If you're driving here for the first time, it can be tricky to find MetroRock Everett, especially in the dark! Use a GPS if possible. MetroRock is in a building opposite Boston Coach.   If you don't have a vehicle, the gym offers a shuttle service from nearby Wellington T Station; call the gym for schedule details.

Q) I've never climbed at MetroRock Gym before, what do I need to do?

A) You'll need to take and pass a belay test for rope climbing. There is a separate test for toproping and sport lead climbing (if you are interested in both). For toproping, if you are not confident you can tie a re-threaded figure-8 knot and double fisherman's backup knot and safely belay a climber using an ATC device, it is highly recommended you take the Basic Safety class. They will not allow you to climb on ropes without passing a belay test. Call MetroRock in advance to reserve your spot in the class, and ask them about any discounts or special prices they are offering. Also, you can rent basic climbing gear (harness, shoes, belay device, etc), if needed, at the gym.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the picnic table near bouldering area (usually the round one, furthest from cubbies, if available).
results.name: MetroRock Monday

Date and time:
We meet on the third Monday of every month, from 7pm to 8:30pm (or later if we decide to go somewhere else after), unless otherwise noted.

Public Transportation:
It is located in downtown Boston, on the corner of Summer Street and Arch Street, across from the Macy's and CVS at Downtown Crossing T [Boston subway] station (Red Line and Orange Line). It is a 5-minute walk from South Station (various T, bus, and train connections), a 5-minute walk from Park Street T Station (Green Line), and a 7-minute walk from State Street T Station (Blue Line).

Parking:
There are parking meters on the street, where you can park for up to 4 hours. Then, they are free after 8pm. After that, parking is free. There is also a paid parking lot a few blocks away at 100 Federal Street, across from the Bank of America building between Franklin Street and Matthew Street. After 5pm, the cost is $10 flat for the day.

Let me know if there are any other questions. See you then!

||

Ĝi troviĝas en la urbocentro de Bostono, ĉe la stratangulo de Summer Street kaj Arch Street, trans Macy's kaj CVS ĉe la "T" [Bostona metroo] stacidomo Downtown Crossing (Ruĝa Vojo kaj Oranĝa Vojo). Parkumado:

Sciigu min se estas aliaj demandoj. Ĝis tiam!

results.description:
(Please note: many of the friends who attend regularly are not Meetup members, so there are always more people attending that it says on the Meetup site.)

About This Meditation Meetup

We sit in silence for around 45 minutes, followed by discussion for around 30 minutes or so. The silent sitting is interspersed with some meditation instruction, perhaps a brief reading, a little simple inquiry, exploration or movement. Sitting posture is relaxed, either on a meditation cushion or a bench. It's not a rigid practice- move whenever you need to!

We meet every Monday night, 7:30 pm at the Cambridge Friends Meeting House. The Friends Meeting House is located at 5 Longfellow Park, Cambridge, MA 02138 You can find a very good map here: <a href="http://www.fmcquaker.org/FMC-Map_2006.pdf" target="_blank"></a>

http://fmcquaker.org/about-friends-meeting-at-cambridge/directions/

Parking is available after 6:00 in the loop off of Brattle St. that leads to the Friend's House, and there is a small lot in back of the Friend's House for those with limited mobility. After that, parking is a little tricky in Cambridge (lots of "resident only" signs), but you will find available parking on Mount Auburn St. near Friend's House and on Brattle St. as you head away from Harvard Square.

Coming by the T is a great option, with the Friend's House being a lovely 15 minute walk out of Harvard Square.

If you find you are running late, come anyway! The format is very relaxed and open— anyone interested in contemplative practice is welcome!

 

About Open Awareness Meditation Group

At the heart of these meditation sessions is the silent exploration of what we refer to as Open Awareness. We all know what it means to feel closed, limited, vulnerable, or separate. What is it like to allow ourselves to return to our natural condition of openness, presence, non-separateness and ease? This is what we explore in our meetings.

We have been meeting for over a decade, and those who lead the meditations have known each other and been practicing together for many years. They have all deeply explored a variety of traditions— for some it has been the Tibetan Buddhist practices of Dzogchen or Mahamudra, for others it has been the Indian traditions of Yoga, or Advaita, or what is currently referred to as Nonduality (some popular examples of this are Francis Lucille, Rupert Spira, Eckhart Tolle and Adyashanti). 

However all of these traditions ultimately point to the same truth, the truth of our basic awareness or presence which is beyond any tradition, practice or teaching. This is the presence we share, and the presence we are, beyond words. This is what we explore in our meetings.

This group is unique in that there is no specific guiding teacher, lama, or guru. We all meet as equals to question, share, and inspire each other to explore the Open Awareness we most deeply are. The meetings are suitable for newcomers as well as experienced meditators, and all are very welcome.
results.name: Open Awareness Meditation Group Meetup

results.description:
The Humanist Hub, in partnership with Harvard College student group the Harvard Community of Humanists, Atheists, and Agnostics (HCHAA), will present Star Wars actress Carrie Fisher with our 10th Annual Outstanding Lifetime Achievement Award in Cultural Humanism as part of a ceremony held at Harvard’s historic Memorial Church on Monday, April 18 at 8:00pm.

This award, created in 2007, honors an individual whose life and contributions to popular culture and society exemplify the values of Humanism: compassion, creativity, and honesty, among others.

In addition to portraying Princess Leia on Star Wars and a long list of acting credits, Fisher, a highly accomplished writer and Hollywood "script doctor," has used her celebrity to uphold values around which The Humanist Hub centers its mission. She is featured in the Emmy Award-winning BBC documentary "The Secret Life of the Manic Depressive," which destigmatizes mental illness, as do her many popular novels and memoirs, including Postcards From the Edge and Wishful Drinking.

Renowned throughout a literary career spanning decades for her bravely honest and deeply funny style, Ms. Fisher's work humanizes a popular culture obsessed with celebrity, and helps readers laugh at the absurdity of contemporary society and relationships. Her forthright activism and outspokenness about addiction, mental illness and agnosticism have advanced public discourse on these issues with creativity and empathy.

The Humanist Hub has hosted similar award ceremonies with comedian Eddie Izzard (2013) author Mary Roach (2012) Seth MacFarlane (Fall 2011) Stephen Fry (Spring 2011) Discovery Chanel’s MythBusters Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman (2010) director Joss Whedon (2009) Bad Religion’s Greg Graffin (2008) and Sir Salman Rushdie (2007).

The Hub, also known as The Humanist Community at Harvard, is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization, dedicated to building a model nonreligious community where humanist values inspire people to connect deeply and change the world. Founded as the first chaplaincy for atheists and agnostics in US history, we have grown into a diverse community serving thousands throughout Greater Boston and helping inspire the growth of similar communities worldwide. To learn more, visit humanisthub.org.


Tickets are available beginning Tuesday, March 29 at the Harvard Box Office.
results.name: Carrie Fisher: Humanist Lifetime Achievement Award (Ticket Required)

group.name: The Humanist Hub in Harvard Square

results.description:
Click Here for a Free Online Webinar: https://www.innerengineering.com/online/free-meditation-webinars-2?signinsrc=Meetup-Boston

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation- 

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.

These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful. 

You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on your own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog
results.name: Isha Kriya Guided Meditation--FREE Class (Online Webinar)

DonQuiSoft - Smart. Mobile. Solutions. Fairfax County EDA - Fairfax County, the heart of the Washington, D.C., economy and the perfect place for your business. Parking

Who should join: Beginners to Advanced speakers interested in learning how to improve their public speaking for fun or professionally.  Reduce your fear and increase your confidence.


Why  members should join: Learn the basics of public speaking, challenge your current skills to be a professional speaker or just to have fun & meet interesting people.  You will also be challenged to give more challenging types of speeches such as ice breakers, humorous and inspirational speeches.

What members can expect out of the group: We have a fast paced 1 hour meeting packed with 2 prepared speeches from members as well as Table Topics where anyone is invited to speak on a suggested topic for 1-2 minutes to hone their ability to speak off the cuff.


You can also join our mentorship program and be assigned an advanced speaker who will guide you to improving your skills.

Lead meetings and presentations at work, begin your path to being a better teacher or professional paid public speaker or simply be a better storyteller.

Tuesday 12pm meeting for members and guests. Please visit for free! 

All are welcome.

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
Join Seth Robinson, CompTIA Senior Director of Technology Analysis, and Teresa Sears, CompTIA Cloud+ Product Manager, to understand the opportunities, competencies required to build your workforce for your flight plan for the cloud.

Cloud computing has redefined how systems are built and permanently changed the landscape of information technology. The industry is moving toward widespread adoption of cloud computing and a basic understanding of how the technology works is of paramount importance for IT professionals. Cloud hype and generalizations have made reaching a consensus on cloud definitions a challenging exercise. A broad understanding is the first step towards standardization of definitions and technologies.

Date: 04/19/2016

Time: 1 P.M. Eastern Standard Time/ 10 A.M. Pacific Standard Time


Agenda:

» The basic components that make up the cloud computing ecosystem.

» The potential impact cloud computing can have on a business.

» The cloud computing skills IT pros will need to support today’s IT infrastructures.

» Q & A with Seth & Teresa

  To receive the link for the Virtual Meetup, REGISTER HERE

Please note that in addition to RSVP'ing to this Meetup, you must register to get access by clicking the register button above.

results.description:
Efficient Buildings And Sustainable Urban Development TECHMEETING  


                                 Powered By The Open Innovation Club

                                 Startups Meet Corporations 

Today, there is a clear revival of cities and re-urbanization of downtown areas. More people want to live in cities and live, work, play within a reasonable distance. The younger generation is also more aware of the impacts of their activities on human health and the environment. Modern urban development has focused on creating mixed-use neighborhoods and transit-oriented development, as well as using more sustainable materials.

At the building level, this means creating a healthy and efficient space for occupants that has a positive impact on the environment. Residential and commercial buildings represent 41% of total energy consumption in the U.S. With growing commitments at the Federal, Regional and City level, there is still a huge opportunity for cleantech startups to develop solutions that will contribute to reducing CO2 emissions and create more sustainable livelihoods.

During this Open Innovation Club Techmeeting, startups and large corporations will get together to discover the latest innovations and develop business relationships around:

·  Sustainable building solutions for resilience, health and safety

·  Smart and connected building technology for energy efficiency

AGENDA 

05:00 pm Doors Open & Registration    

05:30 pm Introduction -  Open Innovation Club & Greentown Labs

05:45 pm  Corporate Presentations

6:10pm Scaling your Business and Working with a Large Corporation

06:20 pm Startup Pitches 

            Metacomb Materials, Senseware, Sense, Foobot, Crowd Comfort, Wespire, Navya 

07:15 pm Networking Cocktail 

IN PARTNERSHIP WITH

results.description:
April 19, 2016 - 5:30-8:30 p.m. (date has been changed from 21st to 19th)
Location: Continuum, 99 High St., 31st floor, Boston, MA (near South Station)
$15 for WITI members; $25 for non-members

WITI Boston is proud to present Heather Lavoie, chief strategy officer for Geneia, on April 19. Heather will talk about her own journey into the technology field, major influencers along the way, and the work that Geneia is doing in the healthcare field, particularly in wearable computing.

Heather leads Geneia’s strategic mission to create solutions using data for actionable insights to predict and improve patient outcomes, reduce costs, and enable care-management collaboration.

During this presentation, we’ll get a real-time look at Geneia’s wearable device to monitor patient vitals, and hear about the industry’s efforts to keep up with changing demographics, technology, and healthcare delivery methods. As with other industries, healthcare is working to leverage the growing power of technology, including Big Data, analytics, and the Internet of Things, to improve its results.

You’ll be inspired by Heather’s perspectives on breaking into a male-dominated industry and rising to the ranks of upper management to the extent that she often has been “the only one in heels.”

Before the presentation, there will be time for networking with your peers. Beverages and light appetizers will be served. Join us for an inspiring and educational evening and learn more about the role of wearables and other technology in the future of healthcare.

Schedule
5:30 pm - Registration and Networking
6:15 pm - WITI Welcome and Introduction
6:30 pm - "The Only One in Heels" Presentation
7:30 pm - Raffle Prizes
7:45 pm - Networking
8:30 pm - Event Ends

Register here:  http://goo.gl/f8mR9Z

About the Speaker:
Heather Lavoie began her career in computer programming and over nearly 30 years has led everything from start-ups, health plan and provider organizations, to initiatives that improve healthcare use and delivery. Prior to her current role, Heather served as a vice president of product development, delivery, and engineering. She is currently chief strategy officer for Geneia, and also has accountability for the sales, marketing, legal, human resources, and client relations functions.

Register here:  http://goo.gl/f8mR9Z

I am very excited to announce that Katie Greeley, Senior Mortgage Consultant at Fairway, will be our guest speaker on Tuesday the 19th. Please see Katie's biography below. If you have time, please submit any questions for Katie in advance. You can email them to [masked]. 

Katie Greeley has been in the mortgage industry for 13 years and joined Fairway Independent Mortgage Corporation’s Newton Branch as a Senior Mortgage Consultant in 2015. Greeley first was drawn to the mortgage industry for the entrepreneurial opportunity to build her own business.  Early on, she developed a specialty in helping couples going through divorce and in working with clients looking to purchase investment properties. Utilizing Fairway Independent Mortgage Corporation’s extensive range of home loan products, including jumbo, conventional, government and Mass Housing, Greeley continues to provide her clients with financing solutions that maximize their purchasing power and enable a faster route to the closing table.

Greeley resides in Newton, MA with her husband and three children. When she is not working she enjoys running, yoga and volunteering within the local community.

This month we will be making Bucket List Journals.

A BUCKET LIST is a number of experiences or achievements that a person hopes to have or accomplish during their lifetime (oxforddictionaries.com).

A Bucket List is also called Wish List, Dream List, Priority List, My List… Let’s not wait to start doing.....

Your LIST should inspire you to dream BIG, live BOLD and be Present and motivated. Let’s the list be your guide you to everything you dream of, every wild adventure.

• “Well behaved women rarely make history”

This meet up is for optimistic, encouraging and friendly women; who would lend and get support from each other that will make the list easier to achieve, and encourage each other to tick as much as they can in their list.

This month we will be making Bucket List Journals. Please bring with you

Your list

A journal/notebook/scrapbook

Glue stick/ Adhesive

Photos and stories

Pens/colored pencils

Stickers/papers/ anything you wanted to use in your journal

No perfumes please we have members with allergies.

There is no charge for this event, however to use there room it is a requirement that EVERYONE that attends order food, I can't stress this enough, the restaurant is in business to make $$ and provide a service.  We are free to use their party room at no charge if we purchase food.  Please be respectful to this request.

Come paddle at one of our practice sessions with Living Root, your 2015 Boston Dragon Boat Festival Grand Champions! We're a social and friendly co-ed team who enjoy the sport of dragon boat paddling. 

Are you new to paddling? No problem! We'll show you everything you need to know to paddle on a dragon boat. This is a great way to meet people, get in shape, and do something fun in the sun.

We meet at 6pm at the docks behind the Barking Crab (88 Sleeper Street in Boston), a short walk from South Station.  We paddle rain or shine, so dress for the weather.  Wear comfortable workout clothing and footwear that you don't mind getting wet. Bring a bottle of water, and we'll provide all the paddling equipment you'll need and a place to lock up your belongings.  We often head out for a quick bite to eat after practice. So come join us!  Send questions to: Dave Parker at [masked]. 

Additional Location and Parking information can be found here

Check out our website or find us on Facebook!

What is Startup Grind?

Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs. We host monthly events in more than 170 cities and 65 countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. results.description:
Guerrilla Marketing to Create Buzz for your Product or Service Guerrilla Marketing is inspired by tactics of Guerrilla Warfare which relies heavily on irregular, unconventional tactics and strategy - think ambushes, raids and elements of surprise!

Likewise, Guerrilla Marketing thrives on unconventional marketing strategies, imagination and creativity. It’s goal is to strike a prospective customer in a personal and memorable way which creates massive amounts of social buzz. Guerrilla Marketing is an ideal method for startups who need to connect with a large audience with limited resources.

Learn from our panelists who will share their unique strategies and how they created their guerrilla marketing campaigns. If you are looking for ways to distinguish your business from the competition, or graduate from marketing lightweight to marketing Ninja, this event is for you!

Panel:

Katie Martell, Co-Founder, CMO, http://cintell.net/the-team/, Twitter: @KatieMartell

Katie Martell is on a mission to help B2B companies better understand their buyers as Co-Founder and CMO of Cintell, a SaaS customer intelligence company. She has spoken at events including TEDx, MarketingProfs, BMA, and more, and often writes about marketing in various publications. As Director of Buzz at NetProspex, (acquired by Dun & Bradstreet) she accelerated the company 2X each year from startup to award-winning organization serving members of the Fortune 500. Katie is a graduate of Emerson College in Boston where she is a scotch enthusiast, ska aficionado, and board member of the American Marketing Association.

Samantha Stone, Founder & Senior Analyst, The Marketing Advisory Network

The Marketing Advisory Network brings strategic planning and hands-on marketing expertise to your organization. The Network specializes in B2B, high growth environments that need the practical advice that drives results. Using expert analytical skills, combined with years of finely honed gut instinct, enables revenue growth, new opportunity identification, improved efficiencies and stronger collaboration between marketing and sales functions.

Samantha Stone is a B2B marketing expert and persona coach,  Throughout her career she has launched go-to-market initiatives and lead marketing strategies for award-winning, high growth companies including Netezza, SAP, Ascential Software and Powersoft.  In 2012 she founded The Marketing Advisory Network to help enterprises unleash the possible within their organizations. She is  also the mother of four high energy boys and wannabe gourmet chef.

You can read more about her marketing philosophy and get practical advice by visiting www.unleashpossibleblog.com or by following her on twitter @samanthastone.

Moderator: 

Stacey Arbetter, Co-founder & CEO of Mutt Maps, Inc., http:/mu ttmaps.com/

Stacey is a Serial Entrepreneur of several successful startups including the leading supplier in North America of an industrial product for the transportation industry and, previously, the largest independent exporter of automobiles in the U.S. She excels at identifying market opportunities and is motivated by new challenges where complex, innovative problem-solving skills and business strategy can bring direct and immediate value to an enterprise.  Stacey’s latest startup is Mutt Maps.  Mutt Maps is a web app developing a community for pet owners that delivers community-reviewed, geolocated, pet-friendly places, services and products.

Organizer:

Dr. Karthik Ganesan, Program Director, Cognizant Technology Solutions, http://www.cognizant.com/

Dr. Karthik Ganesan is the American Program Director for Business Consulting and Enterprise IT at Cognizant Technology Solutions, a NASDAQ listed, Fortune 500 US corporation. He manages a multimillion dollar portfolio of services for corporate customers, leading globally distributed teams to provide domain knowledge and technical  services.

Dr. Ganesan’s experience spans applying optimization and domain knowledge skills to manufacturing, supply chain, logistics and retail operations in large corporations. As a domain leader, he manages teams spread across the USA, Latin America, Europe and India for delivering business and IT projects. He focuses on solving logistics operations and supply chain management and manufacturing problems faced by his customers. He is responsible for leading the business center in implementing full-life cycle solutions to his customers within competitive, time constrained contractual terms. His responsibility extends to internal and external team management, customer satisfaction and securing repeat business for his group. Prior to taking this industry position, he spent over a decade in graduate level teaching and research in both engineering and business schools.

Karthik was granted a Young Scientist Award by the Department of Science and Technology of the Government of India. He was elected a Fellow of the Institution of Engineers (FIE), India, is a member of American Society of Engineering Education (ASEE) and of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE). He is a postdoctoral fellow from The Ohio State University, Columbus. He holds Graduate and Doctoral degrees in Industrial Engineering and Management  from the Indian Institute of Science and an undergraduate degree in Mechanical Engineering.

E-Minute Presentations will be given at the start of the meeting. These very short presentations enable young startup entrepreneurs to gain experience in presenting their summary business plans to expert panels and audiences.

Where: Microsoft Technology Center, 255 Main Street /One Cambridge Center, Cambridge, MA. 02142 Phone: (781)[masked] The One Cambridge Center GENERAL ENTRANCE is on 255 Main Street, Cambridge, across from the Kendall Square Post Office. Exit Kendall Square T Station to Main Street. Once you exit the station, head down the Marriott side of Main Street going in the direction of Boston/the Longfellow Bridge. The One Cambridge Center entrance is located next to the Boston Properties entrance. Enter through the glass revolving door and proceed to the Microsoft facilities on the second floor. Note: There is also a direct Microsoft entrance across from the rotary at the confluence of Main Street and Broadway. See also: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/mtc/locations/boston_directions.aspx

NETWORKING MEETUP ON APRIL 19th @ THE HARBOR SIDE HOTEL FEATURING beGLAMMED! Complimentary admission - 6:00 pm start

Join us for a night of networking with other fashion professionals and then learn about the beGlammed App from it's founder, Maile Pacheco. Admission is free and the connections you can make with other attendees are powerful! Bring your business cards! 

About beGlammed:

beGlammed is the leading on-demand beauty service that delivers professional hairstylists and makeup artists straight to your door. Tap the app to book a personal beauty team and get pampered on-demand in the comfort of your home, office, hotel, or any other location. The go-to mobile hair and makeup provider for everyone from working professionals, students, and busy mothers to brides, jetsetters, and celebrities.

beGlammed was founded in 2014 by Maile Pacheco, a beauty industry veteran, with over ten years of experience working for MAC cosmetics. Frustrated by the inconvenience of having to travel to a salon or retailer to have her hair and makeup done, Pacheco created an on-demand platform to connect clients with professional stylists through an easy booking process, and beGlammed was born.

Our rapidly expanding network of professional hairstylists and makeup artists is a loyal community dedicated to transforming the beauty industry by delivering clients a luxury experience anytime, anywhere.  Clients can rely on beGlammed’s consistent, high quality service across the U.S. and Canada, and conveniently book an appointment at the touch of a button, whether at home or on the road.  beGlammed saves clients’ time, and with three pricing options, the luxury services are accessible for every budget and every occasion.  

Book. Relax. beGlammed!

Founder Maile Pacheco

Maile has been in the beauty and fashion industry for more than 10 years as a professional makeup artist and marketing manager. Before launching beGlammed, she served as Artist Relations Specialist for MAC Cosmetics, where she managed MAC’s professional relationships in the entertainment industry. Her background includes beauty marketing, corporate sponsorships and relationship building with power players in the beauty industry and celebrity makeup artists and hairstylists. She is also a board member of the prestigious Makeup Designory makeup school.


beGlammed offers services in Los Angeles, New York City, Miami, Las Vegas, San Francisco, Toronto, Dallas, Fort Worth, Houston, Austin, Nashville, Atlanta, Palm Beach, Boca Raton, Fort Lauderdale, Phoenix, Scottsdale, Orange County, San Diego, and Orlando . We are actively seeking talented individuals to join our in-house team in Los Angeles.  We’re also looking for excellent hairstylists and makeup artists to join our team in all cities, and especially in the Toronto, Nashville, Orlando, Atlanta, Chicago, Washington D.C., or Boston areas. We encourage you to apply below!


Careers | https://www.beglammed.com/careers/

results.description:
Spades was invented in the USA in the 1930's and is played quite widely in that country. Until recently it has been little known elsewhere, except in a few places where American troops were stationed, for example in parts of Germany. However, since the mid 1990's Spades has become popular internationally because of its easy availability in on-line card rooms on the Internet.

HOW TO GET THERE

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 16, Rt. 28 and Rt. 93, and is walking distance from the T, near the new Station Landing apartment complex. Here is a map of the area.

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28. Although there is free parking all around the building, we recommend that C&C members park in the garage underneath the restaurant or in the front parking lot (because you can see your car from where we sit)

results.description:
Join us for a reading and conversation with Greek writer Christos Ikonomou and translator Karen Emmerich. Ikonomou will read from and discuss his short story collection, Something Will Happen, You'll See (Polis Editions, 2010)—a wrenching yet optimistic elegy to Greece’s working classes. The collection was the most reviewed Greek book of 2010 and the recipient of the prestigious Best Short-Story Collection State Award. It has been translated into six languages and is being published in the U.S by Archipelago in March, 2016.

Christos Ikonomou was born in Athens in 1970. He has published two earlier collections of short stories, The Woman on the Rails (2003) and Something Will Happen, You'll See (2010). Described by Italy’s La Repubblica as “the Greek Faulkner,” Ikonomou writes with profound sensibility, deep humanism and astute foresight about the human condition using the Greek economic crisis as a backdrop.

Karen Emmerich's translations from the Greek include books by Margarita Karapanou, Amanda Michalopoulou, Sophia Nikolaidou, Ersi Sotiropoulos, and Vassilis Vassilikos. Her translation of Miltos Sachtouris for Archipelago was nominated for a National Book Critics Circle Award in Poetry and her translation of Yannis Ritsos's Diaries of Exile with Edmund Keeley won the 2014 PEN Literary Award. She teaches at Princeton University.

Free and open to the public. Wine & cheese reception and book-signing to follow.
results.name: European Voices: A Reading & Conversation with Greek writer Christos Ikonomou

Join us for a night of lightning talks centered on 360 video at Wistia! We'll also have a VicoVR as a special guest showing their body tracking solution for mobile devices.

VicoVR


VicoVR Sensor is a game changing Bluetooth accessory that brings wireless full body tracking capability to Android and iOS ecosystems - without a PC, wires, or wearable sensors!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UUAESrNCYqQ&authuser=0


Lightning Talks

Meta.versatile is a community-driven developer network where VR/AR professionals can profile, showcase, team up and browse.

Making 360 Video Social
360 video is currently a one way experience. A viewer watching a 360 video on YouTube or Facebook can move her phone up and down, and control it with a finger touch.  If she likes it, maybe the video will get a like or a share.Boston360.video seeks to make 360 video social.  We have created a micro services web platform (www.360eCards.com) that lets users embed their own phone videos inside a 360 video for sharing.

VR Doodler


Fresh from Tribeca Interactive day, Cindy will give a recap on the premiere of VRDoodler 1.0, an online browser 3-D drawing/sketching tool that can be paired with audio narratives in mobile VR, such as the story of a Boston refugee family.  Built With three.js, webvr-boilerplate, and html5Go sketch at www.VRDoodler.com!

results.description:
Mettle Fatigue: VW's Single Point of Failure Ethics


Dr. Victor Skowronski will present on the IEEE paper entitled,  "Mettle Fatigue: VW's Single Point of Failure Ethics", by Roland Trope and Eugene Ressler, IEEE Security and Privacy, January/February 2016.  This paper details the events surrounding VW's software for defeating the EPA emissions testing and the ethical culture that allowed this to happen.


Following Dr. Skowronski's presentation, audience members are invited to discuss what these events mean for ethics in software development.

About the Speaker

Victor Skowronski


Victor Skowronski is a system and software engineer currently working at Hanscom AFB as a contractor for the US Air Force. Previously, he worked on models and simulations for Raytheon and Northrup-Grumman. He has a PhD in Computer Engineering from RPI and Masters and Bachelor degrees from Stevens Institute of Technology.

Schedule of Events

6:00-7:00 Networking with pizza and refreshments

6:00-6:45 Roundtables

6:45-7:00 Community Announcements / Job Leads

7:00-7:10 Announcements

7:10-8:25 Presentation and Discussion

results.description:
We start off chatting about our work, including setting goals for ourselves (which is entirely optional but super helpful!), and then we write. That's what it's all about. As simple as the idea is, it's amazing how much more you can get done simply by being in the presence of other writers at work. The baked goods don't hurt, either.


There is power for laptops, and some of us use pen and paper. Your choice! Bonus: there's no Internet access, so you can omit a huge distraction without even trying. And, although we are not a discussion group, there are many areas where people can go if they want to talk without being disruptive.

Please click here for detailed directions! The school can be a bit of a maze and I don't want anybody getting lost.
results.name: Quite Write: Writing Night!

results.description:
We want to grow as a meetup group and in doing so, sometimes it is good to break up into groups and talk about how we can work towards shared liberation using our personal strengths, privilege, and experience. Racial affinity groups give people with shared experiences or privileges the opportunity to collectively reflect on those realities. 


For this session, our focus topic will be the things that motivate us to be involved in anti-racism efforts, the challenges we face, and the limits we place on what we'll do.


We will meet as a large group to begin our conversation before splitting into racial affinity groups to continue. We will come together in the end for closing reflections. Depending on what our attendance looks like, we can have two groups (white and POC) or multiple groups by breaking down POC into different racial groups.

***Because part of the purpose of this meetup is to spend time in racial affinity groups, we want to make sure to have a mix of People of Color (POC) and white people at this meetup.  For that reason, we will be controlling the attendee list more than usual, and will start out with a low limit.  Please go ahead and put yourself on the waitlist if you want to attend, even if it looks like no spots are available.***


Accessibility Information: Community Change, Inc. is wheelchair accessible with the following limitations.  The door to the building is heavy and does not have a button to open it. The elevator doors are slightly more than 30 inches wide.  The fourth floor bathrooms are not wheelchair accessible, but the first floor bathroom is.  Please let us know your needs so we can help make the event accessible for you.
results.name: Racial Affinity Groups: Motivations/Challen­­­ges/Limits for Anti-Racism Efforts

results.description:
Are you curious about programming or thinking about pursuing a career in software engineering? 

Then RSVP on this meet-up page for this 2-hour Intro to Coding class happening in the Boston area at CIC Boston. Learn the basics of programming, do hands-on exercises, and meet new people. All for free!

The class is being taught by MakerSquare, which runs some of the top coding schools in the country.

Class officially starts at 6:30pm, but please arrive at CIC Boston by 6:15pm to mingle with your fellow classmates and settle in. We will end at 9pm, with the last 30 minutes being an optional Q&A session.

What will I learn during the class?

This beginner ­level class will contain several instructor-guided exercises. The class will cover the following topics:

   1. Overview of programming 

   2. Intro to data & data structures

   3. Basics of functions

We ask that you read the Prerequisites section before the start of class and bring your own laptop (Windows, Mac or Linux) with Google Chrome installed.

What is MakerSquare Boston?

MakerSquare is a three-month full-time school for software engineering. By teaching computer science fundamentals and modern web languages like JavaScript, we prepare students to join top flight engineering teams.

We have campuses all over the country, and are excited to be opening a campus in Boston. The free Intro to Coding class is to introduce more people to the wonderful world of programming and to get the community excited about the launch of our full-time class in Boston in July 2016!

Questions? Email us at [masked].
results.name: Free Intro to Coding Class (Tues April 19, 6:30-9pm)

results.description:
Announcements

At the beginning of the meetup we'll have some time for brief 30-second announcement. If you're hiring, looking, or whatever, this is your chance to tell the group.

Server Rendering of Single-Page Applications

</a><a href="https://productpains.com/user/chris-bolin">Chris Bolin, JumpShell

We've used React to build rich single-page applications that are initially rendered on the server. This has the benefits of server-side rendering (SEO, faster initial load, serve clients w/o javascript) without sacrificing the rich client SPA.

Reactive Robots


Chris Puzzo from Rethink Robotics will talk about developing the UI for the "face" UI (video) of the robot, and interfacing with custom hardware.

Chris will also discuss how they've approached rolling React out to a large, cross-functional team that is largely new to web development (mostly robotocists) and general approach to web development w/ React at scale.

results.description:
On Becoming an Artist: Reinventing Yourself Through Mindful Creativity

Just do it! says Nike, a command echoed by Harvard psychologist Langer, who takes up where she left off with Mindfulness (1989) and The Power of Mindful Learning (1997), in which she demonstrated the value of mindfulness, or engaged awareness. Here she outlines ways that are available to everyone to defeat impediments to the creative life, asserting that the doing of art makes us artists. Fear is the obstacle, she says, so set aside external evaluation and self-judgment. These are hardly new concepts, but taken in the broadest sense of Langer's stated goal--the engagement in new, creative endeavors--this energetically written title can help many invigorate their lives with artistic exploration, which is its own achievement. The embrace of uncertainty is as requisite as experiencing the creative moment for making authentic art, she argues, stating that we should value mistakes, and reject absolutes and social comparisons. Langer's latest encourages readers to bravely seek self-reinvention by creative action, and in so doing, find it.

results.description:
Contact me [Jose (click the link, then click "Message")] for the address.

General board gaming. We have a good library of widely played board games, and people normally bring many more of them. We regularly run three to five tables of board games - this provides enough variety.  It is normal for people to get two or three games a session.  The game night format was inspired by Unity Games and the event is very casual and structureless.  If you have gone to one of the meetup's quarterly events you will know.

Q & A:

Q.  What types of games are played?
A.  Any type of board game.  Browse through the most popular games at http://boardgamegeek.com/ and that should give you an idea.

Q.  Until when do you play games?  Can I arrive later than 7pm?
A.  Until the last game of the evening ends, usually past midnight.  Yes, you can arrive later than 7pm, but you may have to wait for a new game to start if you do.

Q.  Should I bring something?  
A.  If you want, bring a game you feel comfortable teaching. There will be pizza and sodas served. Feel free to bring snacks or beverages to share or chip in $5 to $10 for the pizza/sodas in the pizza cup. 

Q.  I really want to play XYZ game, can we schedule it?
A.  Some people ask for interest in a particular game on the event comments below.  This may be the way to make sure you get to play the game you want. 

Q.  Where do I park?
A.  The driveway is the obvious spot, but eventually it will fill up on most of these game nights.  Some people do park on the street.  The soccer field parking across the street is a safe option and is the suggestion the town police gave me when I asked about overflow parking.
results.how_to_find_us: The house is just across from a soccer field.  If the driveway starts to fill up, the soccer field parking lot is a good option.
results.name: Board Games in Sudbury

 This class is for anyone who is interested in working with their heart and hands to provide healing for self and others. Reiki is easy to learn and very peaceful to give and receive. 
       Learn how to provide this simple form of hands-on healing for family, friends, pets or clients. In this class you will learn the history of Reiki, how and why Reiki works, how to align your own energy for healing others effectively, self-healing with Reiki, ethics, and how to start a Reiki practice. You will practice Reiki as well as receive Reiki during the class, and you'll receive the First Degree Reiki attunements  and a First Degree Reiki manual.
  This form of Reiki is traditional Usui Reiki.  Judy is a Reiki Master Teacher and trains Reiki practitioners in First and Second degrees, Reiki Master and Reiki Master Teacher levels.  
      Judy brings to this class her deep knowledge of the healing arts and a lifetime of meditation, yoga and spiritual practices. What you gain from Judy is how to create a healing environment by raising your vibrational capacity. You have the ability to raise your own vibration at will, providing an open channel for Reiki healing to flow through you.  Everyone has a natural healing ability. The Reiki attunements expand the power and awareness of higher energy around us for us to use to bring peace to others and the planet. Now is a great time to offer yourself in service to humanity, and the Reiki attunement helps you to walk this earth in your own place of mastery. results.description:
Ever wish you could disappear on a dangerous street or look more powerful than you feel? (Great for staying safe!)

Ever want to look prettier, sexier, less threatening, more impressive, etc?  

Want to make people feel more comfortable in your presence, build trust faster, make friends easier?

In short, if you've ever wanted to give others a specific impression of you, then glamours are the thing to learn.

The art of the glamour is not one you'll see taught many places and that's because, like any powerful tool, they can be used for good or to manipulate.  So we'll be discussing not only the art of the glamour but the ethics of using them.  

If you are operating in spaces where image matters, where building trust is important, or where safety is a concern, this is a must-take class.  


I've used glamours to become irrelevant to those who might do me harm, to be noticed in a room full of people, to appear more confident than I was.  I learned to use them as a child to make myself feel familiar to people so that I could make friends easier as we moved every year or two to a new place.  I've even used a glamour to appear to be Marilyn Monroe when singing "Happy Birthday, Mr. President" to the president of a company I worked for.  Glamours are incredibly useful.


Here's an example of a glamour above.  Like the apple in my hand?  Look again.  It's a crystal amethyst.  It's actually the only thing in the picture with color and it's purple.  But when I took the picture, I said "want an apple?" and I invoked Eve.  So everyone sees an apple.  That's what a glamour can do.

In this class you'll learn:

• The elements of a glamour

• The requirements to make one work

• The pitfalls of using glamours

• The ethics of using glamours


I've never taught this class before and I don't know when I'll teach it again, so if you want to learn this, now is the time.  

PLEASE ARRIVE 10-15 MINUTES EARLY!  Doors close at 7:00pm - When people trickle in, the class loses focus and momentum.  We will start promptly at 7pm. Be on time or you risk being locked out.  If you are detained due to an emergency, please text me at[masked]

We're limited to 15 people in this class space and our classes tend to sell out well in advance of the class time, so don't wait to register.  

Parking is easily available on the street both at meters and with a parking pass (we have 2 - first come first served). Yes, you'll need a pass unlike on Sundays when it's open parking.  We're also just a half mile walk from the Porter T stop and the 83 and 87 buses stop at the bottom of our street, so we're easily accessible.

PLEASE Do Not Wear Fragrances!  Kelle is extremely allergic to them (yes, even essential oils) and you will be asked to leave if your body spray, cologne, perfume, etc. sets off her allergies.  Litmus test:  if other people who aren't hugging you say "wow, you smell nice!" it's too much scent for Kelle to tolerate.

results.description:
Hi friends,

I work at the Museum of Science, and my department puts on events approximately once per month. They're on science and technology topics, and they involve speaker presentations followed by guided discussions, which we call forums. I'd love if you wanted to come to one (or more!) of my programs, either to support me or because you're interested in the topic. They're free, open to the public, and have refreshments - what more could you want?

The April one is called Editing the Genome: Now We Can. Should We? It's about a new technology called CRISPR that is allowing scientists to edit genomes faster, cheaper, and more precisely than they ever could before. You can see a description here: http://www.mos.org/public-events/editing-the-genome

If you want to come, you should sign up here: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/editing-the-genome-now-we-can-should-we-registration-20707983135 and feel free to also RSVP on this meetup event so people know you're going :)

If you have any questions, feel free to post a comment or send me a message.

Thanks!

Caroline

INSPIRING SOLUTIONS FOR DIFFICULT TIMES                                                                                                     a meditation class series 

TUESDAYS | MARCH 22nd - APRIL 26th


7:00 - 8:30pm

Sometimes life can become overwhelming with difficult and turbulent events. At such times, peace can feel far away. However, just as the center of a hurricane is perfectly still, through meditation we can learn to build a place of peace within. From this inner space, we can make good decisions that foster harmony and happiness for ourself and others.

Join us in this practical course to learn simple and effective meditations for becoming more peaceful and at ease in everyday life. By creating peace within, we can share this with our community, our city and our world. Each class is beginner friendly- feel free to drop-in to any class in the series or try to attend each one!

Feel free to drop-in to any or all of the meditation classes in this series! No need to pre-register. 

with Kadampa Buddhist Teacher, Kyle Davis

results.description:
In most meditations, thoughts are considered a distraction. In this meditation, after an initial period to settle the mind, we'll actually make thoughts the object of our meditation.

We'll start with 20 minutes of meditation in which we settle the mind by paying mindful attention to the breath, ambient sound, or whatever meditation you choose to do.

Then, we'll sit for another five minutes, observing the mind as thoughts rise to attention. Ideally, we won't get hooked by these thoughts, but will observe mindfully as the thoughts come and go.

After the meditation, we'll have a discussion. 

There is no charge for the meditation, and there is nothing you need to bring.

We wrap up around 8:30. You are invited to join us for a bite to eat afterwards in Harvard Square (usually at Cafe Algiers).
results.name: Mindfulness of Thoughts

results.description:
This Meetup is intended for intermediate level players or higher, which means:Yankee C and above level, players with firm understanding of game strategy. Should be able to play 5-1 and 6-2 formations, have a good grasp of skills (passing, setting, hitting) and be able to move around to cover areas of the court. Play should consistently be bump-set-spike.



If you'd like to play, please do the following:


1. Send an email to Kory using the following URL: http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=8675200

2. In the message please indicate the date of event and your preferred position so we can make sure we have the right mix. ( If I don't know your position already)

Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. We will do our best to make sure the event is co-ed, have setters,  and incorporate a couple new members who want to join as well.

The location for this volleyball meetup is at the Orient Heights Community Center located at 86 Boardman Street in East Boston. Kory and Wing will be hosting these Tuesday night volleyball meetups.

This event is free if you are a member of Boston Community Centers. If not, it's a one-time $20 membership fee that is valid for a year. The Community Center is a short walk away from the Orient Heights T Stop on the Blue Line and also has plenty of parking. When you drive up, turn at the Mariott Hotel Sign and park in the lot or further along the fence.

As always, please remember:

- Respect the RSVP system (Don't show up expecting to play without a confirmed RSVP)

- The gym is open before the event to warm up, so please arrive a little early if you would like to warm up and stretch as we would like to start the game promptly from 7:00PM

- If it looks like you won't be able to make it or will run late please cancel your RSVP in time for someone else to join.  Event day/last minute cancellations and no shows will jeopardize your participation in future events.

results.description:
Magnets! How do they work??? This is your chance to learn and play with magnets! Make a refrigerator magnet while you are at it!

We'll also have some electronics to dissect.  Ever wonder what's actually inside a computer, scanner, VCR or DVD player?  Take it apart and learn about the various components!  The turn the "salvage" in a magnet or accessory!

Monthly Make is an adult crafting night. Each month we make something different but in the end you get something to take home. We'll meet on the 3rd floor of the library.

results.description:
Our weekly work session will be at the Cambridge Innovation Center in Kendall Square, on the FOURTH FLOOR, in the CAFE. These Hack Nights are our time to meet in person to work on and discuss civic tech projects. Come by to say hi and hack with us!

Transportation
The Red Line stop for CIC is Kendall. For those who drive, there is a pay parking lot underneath the building, and limited meter parking in the area. Additionally, the MIT Hayward St lot is free after 5pm. Please make sure to check in with security when you arrive.

Schedule
7:00pm - Opening remarks, project updates, announcements
7:20pm - New member orientation
8:00pm - Hacking!

During the event, join our Hackpad for announcement links and collaborative note taking.

To ensure that Code for Boston is a welcoming space for all, staff and participants are held to our Code of Conduct.

results.description:
RSVP here at Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hunting-for-fossil-fat-in-earths-history-tickets-24298838480

Molecular fossils are organic molecules derived from organisms that can be preserved for thousands to hundreds of millions of years in sediments and rocks. Compared to DNA or protein, fats (lipids) have the best chance of being preserved. Lipids also preserve information about the organism that produced them and the environment in which they were produced. In this talk, we will hunt for molecular fossils in the geologic record and reconstruct what life and environments may have looked like at important intervals in Earth's past.


The Speaker: Shane O'Reilly, Postdoctoral Fellow, Earth, Atmospheric and Planetary Sciences Department, MIT


Shane was born in Limerick, Ireland. He holds a BSc in Environmental Chemistry and in 2013 earned his PhD in Organic Geochemistry from Dublin City University. He is currently a Postdoctoral Fellow in Geobiology at MIT. He is funded by the EU Marie Curie Actions Program and the Irish Research Council. If he is not out in the field sampling, doing science outreach, or running, you can probably find him scratching his head in the vicinity of a mass spectrometer.

Directions to Le Laboratoire Cambridge, 650 East Kendall Street Public Transit: Red line to Kendall Square, walk straight down 3rd Street, turn right onto Athenaeum Street, and left onto East Kendall Parking: There is a parking deck - the 650 East Kendall Street Garage - accessible by Linskey Way.


If you purchase food or drink from Le Lab, your parking ticket can be validated for discounted rates.
results.name: CafeSci Boston -  Hunting for Fossil Fat in Earth's History

We will be conducting several unique experiments both here and in the U.K. We will also be experimenting with the effects of infrasound, EVP's, remote spirit communication and more. How does sound play in the role of the paranormal investigator. Join us and find out. Cost $15 Register at the Circles of Wisdom, Andover MA.
