results.description:
Do you ever feel stuck or unsure what to do about your job, relationship…or life? Come learn why your current way of making decisions may not be the best and learn a unique approach to overcome them. Whatever life decisions you’re dealing with -- career, relationships, health, finances -- you’ll leave this event with the tools you need to make better decisions and transform your life. 


Who should come

Do you want to learn how to use your brain more effectively? Do you want to apply the latest research on how we think to help you make better decisions? Are you ready to embrace your inner intuitive guide? If so, then Intuitive MoJo is for you.


The problem with how we think

So many of us are unsure and afraid to make the big decisions, so we keep on doing the same thing, because even if we’re not happy, there is safety in familiarity.

Unfortunately, our current way of making decisions is flawed, and rarely are our decisions as rational as we would like to believe. When it comes to life choices, this can lead us away from our true path, away from happiness. 

Intuitive mixed-media journaling (or "Intuitive MoJo", for short) is designed to help you avoid common thinking mistakes by using your whole brain to make the best decision every time. Your inner guide is hidden in underdeveloped regions of your brain.


What you'll learn in this interactive seminar

• Why your rational "thinking" brain doesn't always get it right

• How your "emotional brain" really calls the shots

• How to use pictures and images to access the wisdom of your emotional brain via the right brain hemisphere

• How journaling opens the pathways of communication between different regions of your brain

• How to use mixed-media journaling to access your own inner wisdom

Never again will you feel lost when faced with an important decision. You will have immediate access to wisdom and insights that are exactly right for you at this moment in time.  


How we will proceed

In this interactive seminar, you will learn about how your brain works and also participate in brief activities as you are introduced to the Intuitive MoJo process.


Intuitive MoJo is grounded in the latest brain research but it’s also a lot of fun!


Questions to think about

Remember a time when you had a big life decision to make and you weren't sure what to do. How did you go about making that decision? 

Have you ever made a bad life decision? How did you go about making that decision?

With Intuitive MoJo, you will use your brain differently to make better life decisions, whether about career, relationships, health or finance.

Our Presenter: Deborah Helen


Deborah Helen, PhD, is an educator-turned-life coach who has studied brain research, cognitive psychology and developmental psychology with a focus on adult development and learning. She regularly engages in meditation, creative visualization and journaling and closely follows the literature on personal development. She is leaving a long career in K-12 and higher education to turn to her long-time passion for life coaching.

After developing the Intuitive MoJo process she began teaching it to small groups in her home with great success. She is currently writing a book about how Intuitive MoJo can help people make better decisions and transform their lives.  The book should be out by fall 2016.

Deb developed Intuitive MoJo when she realized that the popular "rational" approach to decision making simply didn't work for her. She started applying her knowledge of recent brain research to the idea of making better life decisions. Delighted with the results, she began sharing Intuitive MoJo with others.

Visit DeborahHelen.com to learn more about whole brain living. You will find information, exercises, tools and resources that will enable you to re-open the lines of communication with your inner guide. 


Sign up to receive a free guide to accessing your intuition and get notices for new events. A four-week Intuitive MoJo course will be opening in May, with an online course opening in the summer.

Here is what others have to say about Intuitive MoJo

"My experience with intuitive multimedia journaling was truly life changing. I had no idea what to expect when I went into this class, but it opened my eyes to a whole new way of looking at images and ultimately learning about myself and my life through journaling and creating collages." Alex B, marketing and communications


"I absolutely loved the experience! Debbie helped you to center, offers little tips and tricks on how to tap your intuition and use your mind and heart to explore the ideas and images that come to you." Lana C, herbalist


"When I think of Intuitive Mojo I have to call it Intuitive Mojo Creative Artistic Fun and Journaling because the class encompassed so much more than a few words alone could express. This was such a wonderful experience I didn't want it to end." Ann Z.

Brookline, MA
results.name: Deborah Helen: Intuitive MoJo--Mixed-Media Journaling

results.description:
Come join us over fab food and drink at SIP Wine Bar as we discuss On Beauty, by Zadie Smith. It takes place in the Boston area. Here's some info about it:

On Beauty is a novel by British author Zadie Smith. The story follows the lives of a mixed-race British/American family living in the United States, in the fictional university town of Wellington, outside Boston. On Beauty addresses ethnic and cultural differences in both the USA and the UK, the nature of beauty, and the clash between liberal and conservative academic values. It has been described as a "transatlantic comic saga".

Hope to see you there!

NOVICE BLUEGRASS JAM aka “SLOW JAM”- This is designed for novice players, Bluegrass beginners, and “re-entry” players on traditional instruments like guitar, mandolin, and fiddle.  We use mostly 2 and 3 chord songs, call out the chords, and play the songs slowly. This Jam is for you if:

·  you’ve always wanted to  play with others  and want a safe place to start

·  you want to learn Bluegrass from experienced and seasoned players

·  you’re working on the basics of your instrument and want to pick up some pointers,  learn some songs and get some help with technique

·  you’ve been playing for a while, but those advanced Jam are just too much

·  you’re "getting back into it” and want a place to get comfortable again with your instrument  

·  you have fun playing music and want to get more from your instrument.

results.description:
Meditation practice gives us a chance to step away from the busy-ness of our day-to-day lives. It provides space for us to be free from reaction, from expectation, from doing, and step into the gentle space of being.

This weekly practice consists of 25-30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion. Vipassana meditation encourages us to experience each moment exactly how it is, fostering presence and awareness.

In this practice we allow thoughts, emotions, and all other stimuli to surface. We become a witness of these, cultivating a space of non-attachment and revealing a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend. This is a FREE practice. There is a suggested donation, but that is not required to attend.
results.how_to_find_us: Once up the stairs, turn around to your left, and go in the door that is mostly glass panes
results.name: Mindfulness Meditation

results.description:
Awaken the Healing Power within Your Body and Mind

· Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing power

· Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships

· Learn to work constructively with your own emotions

· Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities

· Develop new resources and capabilities

· Become clear about your life’s purpose

Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.

Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.

Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses

Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.

Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.

Discover the passion and power that resides within you

Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind

We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.

Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.

Alternate Tuesdays at 7:30 PM at Unity of Somerville, located at 6 William Street at the corner of College Avenue

Call (913)[masked] to learn more

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.


Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time. I have very limited access to the internet and that can make it difficult for me to respond to emails. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

These classes are not affiliated with any church or religion.

results.description:
Ongoing class in Medieval and Renaissance Longsword in the tradition of Johannes Lichtenauer.


The Longsword is the iconic fantasy Knight's sword - a two-handed, straight blade with a cross guard. The weapon may seem to be simple at first but is in reality a weapon of finesse and skill.


The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.


All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.

Do you want to learn the tech of the Internet of Things?

Free Webinar Class: NYC IoT Course Preview by Bruce Sinclair

Attend this webinar to get a live overview of all IoT tech but instead of presenting the typical technology stack, a value-centric perspective is taken. This approach better explains the interconnectivity and dependencies between system components and uses value generation to look at it from a business point of view. This webinar is for the manager wanting to learn about IoT tech but from a business point of view. We take the perspective of cyber-physical systems to learn: 


• System overview
• Software-defined product
• Hardware-defined product
• Network fabric
• Analytics and external systems (time permitting)

This is an abbreviated version of part of the 1-day course, Internet of Things for Managers which Bruce Sinclair will be presenting in New York City on May 2, 2016.

To register for this 1 hour webinar class click here:

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

Rebooting the Open Government Meetup

Tentatively, we will have reboot brainstorming session the afternoon of Wednesday, April 20th, 2016 online through Google Hangout. If you are interested in participating in this session, let us know so we can take your availability into account when scheduling.  Members who RSVP will be invited to join the session at our Google Hangout channel: plus.google.com/hangouts/_/civics.com/opengovernment 


Note: The time for this hangout will not be confirmed in an update a few days before the event based on the availability of members.  

Why Participate?

We are interested in building open technology for good government and enjoy making free, interoperable tools, simple, streamlined rules and apps easy to use.  

Share your ideas for future topics and activities

What Open Government Meetup events and activities are valuable, interesting and/or enjoyable to you?  Do you want to discuss particular open government topics or hear from specific presenters? Are there open government challenges you want to understand better in order to solve?  Do you have a new Open Government idea you want to try to quickly prototype and test out?   Are there skills with tools, tactics or techniques you want to learn?  

Leading up to the reboot brainstorm, are you interested in adding content or curating a Google Plus page associated with the Open Government Meetup? Check our our page and if you are interested we can grant you access. 


Contribute your ideas about the Open Government Meetup and your availability the afternoon of Wednesday, April 20th, 2016 to help us schedule the Reboot Brainstorm Session: 

http://goo.gl/forms/zmnuIx6UpP

results.description:
Do you VEGETABLE-TARIANS want all the OTHER people (even if they have not committed to be vegetarians) to eat fresh produce?  Then help us - each Wednesday late afternoon - bag vegetables (and some fruit) for the neighbors in Mission Hill.  Usually there are also freshly-baked loaves of bread, also (baked that morning - Jessica's Bakery).

It's an assembly line, then take home a bag (or two) of produce for yourself. 

Bring your business cards, smartphone, or notepad, and prepare to exchange contact info with other volunteers you like.  Volunteers come from several sources (not merely this meetup or others:Craigslist, Pharmacy School, School of Public Health, etc.) 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill
Tobin Community Center
1481 Tremont Street - inside the front entrance
Mission Hill, Roxbury
(between Brigham Circle and Roxbury Crossing T stops)
Boston, MA 02120 - <2 blocks from Orange Line T Each Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm (indoors in bad weather)


We will be VOLUNTEERING for the weekly Wednesday late afternoon $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill.

When you volunteer,
YOU will ALSO TAKE HOME one or two of those "$2 bags"! 
We've had 55 volunteers, and we've had 7.  Workloads vary!

Fair Foods provides a 20-22 bag of produce for the Mission Hill neighbors so they can eat like me - on produce. The neighbors only need to pay' $2 for the bag.

Volunteers unload the truck, set up 3 banquet tables, set up the food in order of desntiy (heavy food, such as potatoes or onions, on the bottom - lighter, more perishable foods, such as tomatoes and bananas and berries and kale on top), then fill each bag (and 'stack' them upright by one another - for the 'paying neighbors' to pick up (for $2).

Some arrive as early as 3:30 pm (you don't NEED to do that, but you're welcome to do so; OUR meetup's attendees - it's posted on 6 meetups - are often there early, and you can chat).

We (MOST of us) arrive around 4 pm (maybe as late as 4:30 pm) and work until 6 pm (can leave as early as 5:30 pm if we've finished).

In the FRONT of the Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street (between the Brigham Circle T stop - GREEN E-Line - and the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line T stop), behind the wrought iron fence.

Wear comfortable clothing that allows you to move flexibly and to actually work, lifting heavy bags of food. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Tobin Community Center 
1481 Tremont Street, Boston, MA

THERE IS NO PARKING - IT'S BEST FOR THOSE WHO LIVE IN BOSTON AND TRAVEL IN ON THE MBTA

THERE IS NO PARKING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

Every Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Bring friends!  Forward the invitation to others!

Invite FRIENDS through the Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter 'share' 
buttons
http://www.yelp.com/events/boston-volunteering-for-2-bag-of-produce-in-mission-hill-each-wednesday-afternoon-from-4-6-pm-at-tobin-community-center

Looking for an ARTIST to help VISUALLY REPRESENT this vegetable outreach effort.
TALK with us FIRST !!

results.description:
Do you VEGETABLE-TARIANS want all the OTHER people (even if they have not committed to be vegetarians) to eat fresh produce?  Then help us - each Wednesday late afternoon - bag vegetables (and some fruit) for the neighbors in Mission Hill.  Usually there are also freshly-baked loaves of bread, also (baked that morning - Jessica's Bakery).

It's an assembly line, then take home a bag (or two) of produce for yourself. 


Bring your business cards, smartphone, or notepad, and prepare to exchange contact info with other volunteers you like.  Volunteers come from several sources (not merely this meetup or others:Craigslist, Pharmacy School, School of Public Health, etc.) 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill
Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street
Mission Hill, Roxbury
(between Brigham Circle and Roxbury Crossing T stops)
Boston, MA 02120 - <2 blocks from Orange Line T Each Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm (indoors in bad weather)

We will be VOLUNTEERING for the weekly Wednesday late afternoon $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill.

When you volunteer,
YOU will ALSO TAKE HOME one or two of those "$2 bags"!
We've had 55 volunteers, and we've had 7.  Workloads vary!

Fair Foods provides a 20-22 bag of produce for the Mission Hill neighbors so they can eat like me - on produce. The neighbors only need to pay' $2 for the bag.

Volunteers unload the truck, set up 3 banquet tables, set up the food in order of desntiy (potatoes on bottom - tomatoes and bananas and berries and kale on top), then fill each bag (and 'stack' them upright by one another - for the 'paying neighbors' to pick up (for $2).


We arrive around 4 pm (maybe as late as 4:30 pm) and work until 6 pm (can leave as early as 5:30 pm if we've finished).

In the FRONT of the Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street (between the Brigham Circle T stop - GREEN E-Line - and the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line T stop), behind the wrought iron fence.

Wear comfortable clothing that allows you to move flexibly and to actually work, lifting heavy bags of food.

Our Happy Hours are targeted towards entrepreneurs, small business owners, investors, and people looking to network with Coalition members. We have all sorts of beers, chips, dip, and N64 games! We would love to meet you, have a conversation, play some Mario Kart, or just have a laugh! :]

Coalition: Boston is a flexible office and coworking hub for small businesses and startups. Located in the center of Downtown Boston, we are a strong, close-knit community of entrepreneurs, investors, and professionals who love to celebrate Hump Day on Wednesdays.

Thank you to our Sponsor, Oasis Outsourcing!

Originally formed in 1996 as a subsidiary of The Wackenhut Corporation, Oasis Outsourcing is one of the largest Professional Employer Organizations (PEOs) in the nation (as noted in the Staffing Industry Analysts list of largest PEOs published in August 2014), providing human resources, employee benefits, payroll, and risk management services on an outsourced basis. WIth annual revenue exceeding 6.2 billion, Oasis Outsourcing is an industry leader. Serving almost 6,000 clients and 200,000 worksite employees throughout the United States, Oasis Outsourcing is a recognized expert in all aspects of human resources managment.


Thank you to our Annual Sponsor, Botkeeper!

Botkeeper does everything a bookkeeper can do, only faster, 24/7, with more reporting, beautiful dashboards, and at a fraction of the cost. With the use of software and machine learning, botkeeper automates much of the day to day data entry, classification, and aggregation of information into reports and dashboards. Unlike a traditional bookkeeper, botkeeper is continuously improving and becoming more efficient over time, leading to amazing scalability and big savings for our clients. Knowing it is impossible to automate everything, all botkeeper clients are paired with a dedicated botkeeper CPA to provide a personal touch, advice, and quality assurance. FAQs

Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?

You must present an ID to security to gain access to the building. 21+ event. What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?

We are located right above the Downtown Crossing T stop, part of the Red and Orange lines, and one stop away from the Green line at Park Street. Garage parking options can be found here: www.coalitionspace.com/parking Can I bring a friend?

We'd be dissapointed if you didn't. But if you don't have any friends, you can make some here! :)

What if I have a nut allergy?

We have Klondike bars!

What's the deal with airline food?

You'll have to ask Jerry Seinfeld.

results.description:
The Elusive Demos: Democracy in the Digital Age 

Wednesday, April 20th, 5-7pm

Harvard University - Science Center Lecture Hall A

1 Oxford Street, Cambridge

Democratic societies are caught up in unprecedented political upheavals that are questioning some long-established principles of representative government. Do political parties matter? Are compromise and civility necessary for governing well? Do interests and identities take precedence over other bases for solidarity, including the ties of nationhood? All four countries represented on this panel—US, UK, Israel, India—are confronting these challenges in unique ways. In each, new digital technologies are centrally implicated in turning conventional democratic processes on their heads. Our discussion will be led by four of the most provocative and knowledgeable voices contributing to democratic theory today, all with specific insights into the realignment of politics and political subjectivities in the digital age. 

:: :: ::

Panel includes

• Yaron Ezrahi, Gerstein Family Professor Emeritus of Political Science, The Hebrew University of Jerusalem

• Andy Stirling, Professor, Science and Technology Policy, Science Policy, Science Policy Research Unit, University of Sussex

• Shiv Visvanathan, Professor and Vice Dean, Jindal Global Law School, O.P. Jindal Global University

Comment by Jane Mansbridge, Adams Professor of Political Leadership and Democratic Values, Harvard Kennedy School

Moderated by Sheila Jasanoff, Pforzheimer Professor of Science and Technology Studies

:: :: ::

This event is organized by the Program on Science, Technology & Society at the Harvard Kennedy School and co-sponsored by the John A. Paulson School of Engineering and Applied Sciences, the Graduate School of Design, and the Harvard University Center for the Environment. For more information on Science, Technology & Society events at Harvard University, please visit: www.sts.hks.harvard.edu/. This lecture and discussion is free and open to the public. Contact: Laura Hanrahan - Communications Coordinator - Harvard University Center for the Environment - 24 Oxford Street - Cambridge, MA 02138 - [masked] - p. [masked]

Science and Democracy, a lecture series aimed at exploring both the promised benefits or our era's most salient scientific and technological breakthroughs and the potentially harmful consequences of developments that are inadequately understood, debated, or managed by politicians, lay publics, and policy institutions.
results.name: Democracy in the Digital Age

Who should join: Beginners to Advanced speakers interested in learning how to improve their public speaking for fun or professionally.  Reduce your fear and increase your confidence.


Why  members should join: Learn the basics of public speaking, challenge your current skills to be a professional speaker or just to have fun & meet interesting people.  You will also be challenged to give more challenging types of speeches such as ice breakers, humorous and inspirational speeches.

What members can expect out of the group: We have a fast paced 1 hour meeting packed with 2 prepared speeches from members as well as Table Topics where anyone is invited to speak on a suggested topic for 1-2 minutes to hone their ability to speak off the cuff.


You can also join our mentorship program and be assigned an advanced speaker who will guide you to improving your skills.

Lead meetings and presentations at work, begin your path to being a better teacher or professional paid public speaker or simply be a better storyteller.

Tuesday 12pm meeting for members and guests. Please visit for free! 

All are welcome.

results.description:
"In a Haze: Studying Marijuana"
Guest scientists Staci Gruber, Seth Blumenthal, Jodi Gilman & Anne Short

Meet us Wednesday, April 20, 5:30pm – 7:30pm at Aeronaut Brewing Company!

It’s 4/20, so Harvard’s Science by the Pint is teaming up with the Aeronaut Brewery and the Cambridge Science Festival to learn about the science of marijuana! Our researchers are here to discuss with you the challenges of studying a (mostly) illegal substance, and get into their research on the effects of marijuana on the brain, the environmental issues around growing weed, and how America’s relationship with the drug has evolved. So grab a beer and get talking! 


Science by the Pint is a monthly science cafe free and open to the public, run by the Harvard non-profit outreach group Science In The News (SITN). Read more here: http://sitnboston/science-by-the-pint/

Release Date:

April 15, 2016


Rating:

PG-13


Synopsis:

SING STREET takes us back to 1980s Dublin seen through the eyes of a 14-year-old boy named Conor (Ferdia Walsh-Peelo) who is looking for a break from a home strained by his parents’ relationship and money troubles, while trying to adjust to his new inner-city public school where the kids are rough and the teachers are rougher. He finds a glimmer of hope in the mysterious, über-cool and beautiful Raphina (Lucy Boynton), and with the aim of winning her heart he invites her to star in his band’s music videos. There’s only one problem: he’s not part of a band…yet. She agrees, and now Conor must deliver what he’s promised - calling himself “Cosmo” and immersing himself in the vibrant rock music trends of the decade, he forms a band with a few lads, and the group pours their heart into writing lyrics and shooting videos. Inspired by writer/director John Carney’s (ONCE, BEGIN AGAIN) life and love for music, SING STREET shows us a world where music has the power to take us away from the turmoil of everyday life and transform us into something greater.

results.description:
Wanna try us out? Come join us at our water training sessions! No prior experience necessary. 

• First two practices are $10 (The $10 can go towards the full membership of $110 for the rest of the season). Pay via Paypal ("Boston 1 - Join us") or venmo (@boston1dboat).</a>

• Also you will not be allowed on the boats if you do not sign the waiver: <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Ll2NR3MZbV3O7ZrmPdZsCbKRaC_G8KKa7lwBUlC59Pk/viewform?c=0&w=1">"Boston 1 e-waiver" 

• Make sure to check our Facebook,</a><a href="http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook">http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook for practice announcements and cancellations -- especially in the early and later parts of season with potentially colder night practices. 

Weekly practices are every Monday, Wednesday and Saturday unless a race is scheduled or practice is cancelled.

Mon & Wed: 5:45pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab. 
Sat: 10:45am - 1pm, meet 10.45am on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab.

Optional dinner/lunch or social activity afterwards!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather and water! Be prepared to get wet!

• Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards. 

• Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended. 

• Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen. Expensive glasses or sunglasses are not recommended. 

All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locked locker provided on-site. Please bring as little as possible to practice as space is limited.

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in Twitter, Facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook

Parking: Channelside Parking at 284 A Street. Enter at 29-41 Necco Street, off Melcher Street. Weekend $5 flat rate. Weekdays $8 flat rate (in after 3pm). More details can be found here: http://bit.ly/1Nxv1lw.

Restroom: Do not use the restrooms in the Barking Crab, use the public restrooms near the Daily Catch

Public Transport: Closest T stop is South Station on the red line.

Hope to see you there!

Free. Fun. Starts here!

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace. 

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners 

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week 

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising. 

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

https://youtu.be/OndSmceU9R4

The Revolve Nation's Boston Entrepreneurs Network is the largest community of entrepreneurs and business owners in the city of Boston, offering networking, discussion groups, seminars, business plan hot-seats, and more!

Join us here, where professionals and entrepreneurs meet in mutual support of business to network, socialize, learn, and promote a thriving community of entrepreneurs. Wine and snacks provided!

Schedule:

6pm-6:30pm  -- Open Networking over wine and snacks

6:30-6:45pm  -- Meeting Called to Order and Introductions

6:45--7:45pm -- Open discussions on topics of interest to our members (examples; Getting funded, building a team, using mailing lists and their effectiveness, firing a difficult employee) Suggest your own topics as comments on the event, or simply bring them with you!

7:45-8:00pm  -- More Networking! (and wine!)

Like anything in life, what you put into a networking group is what you get out of it. The Boston Entrepreneurs Group is designed for entrepreneurs and professionals who are serious about building their business, investing in relationships, and helping each other to succeed.

The way the group seeks to achieve these outcomes:

1) Regular attendance

2) Dedication to coming prepared to contribute value to the community with expertise, experience, and networks.

3) Create a fun and supportive environment!

Price: FREE

SPONSORS: Revolve, Inc.: www.revolvethis.com

Exemplar Law: www.exemplarcompanies.com

See you soon!

results.description:
Leadership speech: How To Improve Your Impromptu Speaking?

SPEAKER:
Kit Pang, TEDx Speaker Coach, founder of BostonSpeaks and the Superhero Institute.

ABSTRACT: 


Impromptu speaking or speaking off-the-cuff is speaking without any planning or preparation.  These situations occur every day in your personal or professional life.   In one-on-one conversations you might engage in a debate with a friend or your boss might ask for your input on a project.  A co-worker calls in sick and ask if you can speak on her behalf during the group meeting.  You might even have to give an impromptu speech at a special occasion or be called upon on to give an unexpected toast.  

More details at:

• http://goo.gl/forms/B1ydw3Zwpg
results.how_to_find_us: CIC 5th floor, one Broadway, Kendall Square, Cambridge, MA
results.name: Leadership speech: How To Improve Your Impromptu Speaking?

Wednesday, April 20th, 6-8pm

Brattle Theatre – Cambridge

CMF member Anita Harris is working with producer/director Jen Myronuk and can offer free tickets to members who sign up HERE. If those run out, you can also buy tickets at the theater. 

:: :: ::


What if you could time travel to 1915 Paris and meet one of the world’s greatest scientists?  Take part in a captivating evening of narrative science & living history on Wednesday, April 20th @ 6pm at the Brattle Theatre with a preview screening of the short film Humanity Needs Dreamers:  Marie Curie (née Maria Skłodowska) is best known for the discovery of radioactivity, including the first successful treatment for cancer, but few understand the obstacles she faced just to get into the laboratory. Experience Marie’s remarkable journey from her childhood in Poland through groundbreaking research in France, and further international prominence. Humanity Needs Dreamers: A Visit With Marie Curie explores the tenacity of the human spirit and the enduring allure of scientific discovery. 

http://www.storysmith.org/manya

For more info, contact producer Jen Myronuk at [masked]. 

Wednesday, April 20th 6-8pm - Brattle Theatre - 40 Brattle Street, Cambridge

http://www.brattlefilm.org/2016/04/20/humanity-needs-dreamers-a-visit-with-marie-curie/

COMPLIMENTARY TICKETS AT http://mariecurieapril20.eventbrite.com

results.description:
The Stone Lady - Will Rock our World - Rock Readings

Wednesday, April 20, 2016


6:00 PM

Sal's pizza Woburn

I have had the pleasure of working with "the stone lady" on several occasions and she has been right on with all her readings.  She has taught me so much in these few meetings that I have also become attuned with reading stones.  Come out for a night of fun and some readings (how many depends on group size).


Cost for event:  $12.00  

Payments:  Please make checks payable to Terry Milton, please mail checks to Sue Collins, 25 Shady Ave., Wakefield, MA 01880  AGAIN, CHECKS PAYABLE TO TERRY MILTON

She's up-beat, down-to-earth and reads stones based on parallels, similarities, and synchronicities which exist between human nature and Mother Nature.

The Stone Lady, as many call her,  has studied many conventional as well as non-traditional psychic tools, including Tarot, Numerology, Palmistry, Sense Awareness, Earth Magic, Astrology, and Channeling. She is the original Stone Reader, and is the creator of Stone Readings.

The Stone Lady’s knowledge of stones and crystals is based largely on her many decades of combining her psychic gifts with her love of nature. She has utilized and combined her wisdom gained through private apprenticeships, nature meditations, journaling, channelling, and attuning to the magic and enchantment of the mineral realms. Her Stone Readings gradually evolved as she began to notice uncanny parallels and similarities between “Mother Nature” and “Human Nature,” and between the ‘world of people’ and the ‘world of stones.’

Because of her connection with her stones and crystals, The Stone Lady  is able to attune to you via the specific stones which are aligned or connected with you. She will offer insights with authentic clarity to help you make wise choices along your path!

Please only rsvp if you can make it.  This event may be cross posted in other meetups.  Same day cancellations will count as a no show.

Please no fragrances/perfumes, we do have members that are severely allergic, thank you for your consideration.
results.how_to_find_us: back party room

results.description:
We're excited to have Michael Kane from Yale presenting again for our April Meetup.

Abstract:

From ordinary least squares (OLS) to lasso and elastic-net regularized models, fitting data using linear regression is one of the most powerful and common approaches to understanding the structure of data. However, while there are many resources for understanding their statistical properties and their optimality characteristics only a few describe how to implement these models. In this talk I'll show how OLS, GLM, Ridge, and ElasticNet models fit into a single computational framework that can be implemented in short, understandable snippets of R code. I'll also show how this framework is used in the ioregression package, which fits linear models out-of-core.
results.name: Michael Kane - Writing Regression Routines in R

results.description:
Do you want to come across as a professional who speaks in a clear, articulate and confident manner while speaking on-the-spot? Join us and practice the art of impromptu speaking. Did we mention Free Pizza!?

Takeaways:

• Tips & advice on how to speak off-the-cuff

• Public speaking secrets to help you own the floor

• Impromptu speaking exercises and feedback sessions 

What is Impromptu Speaking? Impromptu speaking or speaking off-the-cuff is speaking without any planning or preparation. These situations occur every day in your personal or professional life. In one-on-one conversations you might engage in a debate with a friend or your boss might ask for your input on a project. A co-worker calls in sick and ask if you can speak on her behalf during the group meeting. You might even have to give an impromptu speech at a special occasion or be called upon on to give an unexpected toast. 

“Communication is a skill that you can learn. It’s like riding a bicycle or typing. If you’re willing to work at it, you can rapidly improve the quality of every part of your life.” - Brian Tracy 

Speaker Bio: Kit is a TEDx Speaker Coach and the founder of the BostonSpeaks. He loves to work with entrepreneurs to hone their communication skills while offering engaging and insightful experiences through communication seminars for organizations. (www.bostonspeaks.com)


Collaboration with BostonSpeaks, Pentalog, Agilizza Event

Register here:

• http://goo.gl/forms/B1ydw3Zwpg

results.description:
Come join us for a midweek climb!


To the left there is a chip-in feature. Your donations will go directly to the monthly dues and will allow MAC meetup group to keep going. Any amount would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

All levels are welcome! If you are new to climbing, there is a belay class at 7 PM. Here is the link to sign up: www.centralrockgym.com/bookeo.php?s=watertown 

I will happily belay those who have not climbed before up until 7 PM, but then it's really important to know how to belay and to take the belay test that starts at 7 PM. You can rejoin the group after taking the belay test.

For those of you who already know how to belay, no need to take the class, you just need to pass this gym's belay test when you arrive.

The price is as follows:

Membership: $89/month

Adult Day Pass: $22 

Gear (shoes, harness, belay device): $8 ($5 for members)

Belay class: $15 (free for members)

Belay test: Free

We will meet at the cluster of cubbies on the first floor at 6:30 PM, greet each other, make sure everyone has a group or person to climb with then head off to climb. I'm looking into whether there is a place nearby to grab a bite or drink at the end of the night. If you have a place in mind, please let me know.

I'll send a message letting you know what color shirt and pants I am wearing incase you arrive late and want to search for us. I will also swing by the cubbies every 15 minutes until everyone who signed up has arrived. So, if you are not able to make it or are running late, PLEASE COMMUNICATE on this event's chat or by contacting my cell-phone, which I will send out once you are confirmed for the event.

Hope you can make it! I'm looking forward to meeting more climbers in the area.

~Avery~
results.how_to_find_us: Will meet at 6:30 PM at the cubbies by the stairs

Please come out and join us for a pleasant evening of competitive party bridge in  Newton Centre.  Wednesday night bridge here has been a multi-year Metrowest tradition; it is a nice quiet spot with a fireplace, good food, ample table space.  The more the merrier, so long as you know how to play bridge and love it.

This is officially canceled unless 5 players sign up by 5pm. We can still play with four if we re-confirm. Check this space at 5pm if quorum questions exist. Out of courtesy, please do not sign up casually, nor cancel out on the day of event except in emergencies.

You must know Contract Bridge rules and basic bidding to play this week. No formal training is to be offered, but this is a social, casual event. To assist novices, bidding advice and meanings will be openly discussed on any player's request.

ACBL Yellow Card is our group-standard bidding system; a novice should please take time to study all basic openings and responses shown above in yellow, plus standard Jacoby Transfer and Stayman responses to NT openings. We will expect a verbal alert on deviations an expert may make to these most-common conventions.

results.description:
Another fantastic lineup this month, including guest speaker and GHC engineer Austin Seipp joining us from Austin, TX.

START TIME CHANGE: As mentioned last time, per Akamai's request, we will be changing our start time to 6:30 for good. As usual, we'll hang out and have pizza for the first.

6:45-7:45: Austin Seipp - Fast, production ready binary serialization.

In the Haskell world, the venerable binary package has been serving us well for almost a decade, for both inter-operability between systems and general serialization purposes. Yet, in the real world we can improve upon binary dramatically in output size, code speed, and memory use - all on top of a more modular design.

In this talk, I'll discuss and give a broad overview of the (eventual) successor to binary: binary-serialise-cbor. We'll go over it's fundamental design differences with binary, performance numbers, current development status, and future plans. At the end, we'll also talk about what it takes to 'productionize' a Haskell library of this nature for general users and developers.

8:00-9:00: Alexey Radul - Probabilistic Programming Live-code

I will live-code a small program for a (toy) problem we normally think of as requiring (a little) intelligence.  I'll code it in Venture, a probabilistic programming platform my research group and I have been developing for the last few years.  (If there's time, I could also show a similar program written in Haskell, but it's a good deal longer and trickier.)  I hope to illustrate some of the basic characteristics of trying to program things that are supposed to show a little "creativity"; and I'll say a few words about machine learning too. Statistics will be kept to a minimum.

Speaker Bios:

Austin Seipp:

Austin is a software developer at Well-Typed LLP, living in Austin TX and writing Haskell for clients around the world. He's primarily known in the Haskell universe as a GHC developer and tinkerer, but does in fact do other things. In a prior life, Austin did application security research and development, and before that, worked on data backup software. His interests include code optimization, cryptography, programming language implementation and general low-level computer nonsense.

Alexey Radul:


Alexey is a research engineer at MIT, with the Probabilistic Computing Project http:://probcomp.csail.mit.edu/.  His coworkers call him the lead developer of the Venture probabilistic programming platform, for two years now.  Previously, Alexey has worked on automatic differentiation, optimizing compilers, and the propagator model of computation.

Logistics:

If you can, please plan on arriving between 6:15pm and 6:30pm, but there will be someone in the lobby to greet stragglers.

Food:

Pizzas, salad and soda.

Afterwards:

If you'd like to stick around, a number of us tend to head down to the CBC or another pub afterwards to socialize. If you would like to give a talk or if you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to follow up here or email one of the organizers.
results.how_to_find_us: Simply come to the front door of Akamai. If you can, please plan on arriving between 6:15pm and 6:30pm, but there will be someone in the lobby to greet stragglers.
results.name: Talks by Austin Seipp and Alexey Radul!

results.description:
Join us at our third Neuromarketing-palooza event on Wednesday, April 20th, 2016. We are extremely excited about the line-up we have in store for you. The evening's featured presentations will be: 

A Behind-the-Scenes Look at Nielsen Consumer Neuroscience's Research

Naomi Nuta, VP of Client Service at Nielsen Consumer Neuroscience, will provide an overview of the company's history, background & perspective on market research. Further, Naomi will share several case studies that demonstrate how neuromarketing tools can be applied to: 

•  Measure consumer experiences with digital content and/or advertising on multiple platforms 

• Website design & UX

• Natural experiences exploring digital environments (e.g., social media platforms)

Naomi helps clients to push the envelope on 100 years of established market research practices, using research insights that inform impactful business decisions. Naomi has spent the past decade specializing in advertising, consumer messaging and brand positioning research using quantitative and qualitative methodologies. Her work measuring biometrics led to a first place win, with MTV Networks and Spike TV, in the 2011 Cable & Telecommunications Association for Marketing Insights Conference Case Study Competition.

All That $50 Will Reveal about Your Target Audience

Stacey Dyer, Creative Strategist at iZotope, will teach you how $50 can be used to reveal who wants to buy your product or service, where they are, and what makes them want to buy. In her presentation, Stacey will cover:

• The market research that validates early adopters, value proposition, and messaging resonance through four $50 Facebook ad tests

• The benefits of this type of testing prior to launching a product/service

• How to formulate goals and build ad experiments

• Methods for measuring results

Stacey is a mentoring, marketing, and entrepreneurial renaissance woman. She is a creative strategist at work, and an avid runner, designer, vocalist, and writer for play. Currently the liaison between product and marketing for the Spire brand at iZotope, Stacey pushes the team to go beyond their usual boundaries through lean practices, as well as process discovery and customer validation. She previously served as iZotope's Product Design Director, and acted in the capacity of Creative Director for brands such as Force Factor, Oliva Cigars, Shields MRI, and Kidcity Children's Museum.

***

The event is free, and so is the all-you-can-eat pizza.


Sign up today. Will be an educational and fun evening!
results.name: Neuromarketing-palooza (April 2016)

results.description:
Show us your Ansible Workflow

Myles Steinhauser, Staff Software Engineer at Blue Box @ IBM & Peter Nealon, Senior Solutions Architect at G2 Tech Group

How do you go from new config management request to fully functioning and testing code that is running in “production”?  How do you know that the requirements are met and that its ready to be deployed?  We will walk through the process from request to deployable feature and have some fun along the way.

Ansible 2.0 and Beyond


Timothy Appnel, Principal Architect at Ansible

Please join us for an overview of Ansible 2.0 and beyond with Timothy Appnel from Ansible. Tim will explain why the update was necessary, what has changed in Ansible, and what you can expect from Ansible moving forward. You'll also learn about new features available in Ansible 2.0, including:

•  Task blocks

•  Execution strategies 

• Refined playbook parser 

• Increased flexibility 

• New modules and plugins 

A Q&A session will follow as time allows.

Timothy Appnel is a Principal Architect and "Jack of all trades" at Ansible with over 25 years of corporate IT and startup experience across numerous industries. Tim is an old-timer in the Ansible community that has been contributing since version v0.5. The synchronize module in Ansible is all his fault.

Thank you to Ansible and Red Hat for sponsoring food and drink for this event!

Thank you to WeWork Fort Point for hosting the event!

WeWork is a community for creators. results.description:
REGISTER HERE: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/ipfs-ethereum-mit-meetup-tickets-24578852008 


Come join Juan Benet and others from Protocol Labs to learn about IPFS and Ethereum dApps that use this new distributed protocol.


IPFS, the InterPlanetary File System, is making the web faster, safer, decentralized, and more open. It is a new hypermedia distribution protocol, addressed by content and identities.
Think Git + BitTorrent + The Web. IPFS is in use by thousands of developers, for all kinds of things from distributing files more efficiently, to making decentralized chat applications, to giving permanent addresses to content, to hosting content for Blockchains. IPFS is one of the hottest and fastest growing Open Source projects! 

Come learn about Ethereum dApps that are using IPFS to host decentralized content. ConsenSys will present uPort, a project using programs on the Ethereum Blockchain and content on IPFS to maintain identity records that are permanent, uncensorable, and controlled only by you! The uPort attestation system allows third party authorities as well as peers to validate the user's information creating both a rich social fabric as well as powering solid KYC/AML systems in the financial sector.


You can learn more about IPFS at https://ipfs.io and https://github.com/ipfs/ipfs

This is the first IPFS Boston Meetup! Don't miss this opportunity to hang out with IPFS and ConsenSys! Join us for an exciting evening of p2p, filesystems, Ethereum, and apps.

Agenda (preliminary) 

• Intro to IPFS  (Juan Benet)

• Into to IPLD (Juan Benet)

• Why Decentralization? - (Nicola Grecco)


• uPort - ConsenSys Ethereum dApp using IPFS  (Carolyn Reckhow)

• Orbit Demo (Juan Benet)

• Questions 

• Food & Networking

Sponsored by ConsenSys and The MIT Bitcoin Club.
results.name: IPFS & Ethereum: MIT Meetup

results.description:
Senhor José is a low-grade clerk in the city's Central Registry, where the living and the dead share the same shelf space. A middle-aged bachelor, he has no interest in anything beyond the certificates of birth, marriage, divorce, and death that are his daily routine. But one day, when he comes across the records of an anonymous young woman, something happens to him. Obsessed, Senhor José sets off to follow the thread that may lead him to the woman-but as he gets closer, he discovers more about her, and about himself, than he would ever have wished.

The loneliness of people's lives, the effects of chance, the discovery of love-all coalesce in this extraordinary novel that displays the power and art of José Saramago in brilliant form.

results.description:
Here are just some of the things you can get out of these meetings:

• Access to thousands of dollars of courses, software, and other resources

• Advice on overcoming a business or marketing obstacle you're facing

• Accountability, so you actually get your work done and turn your dreams into reality

• Ideas and inspiration to help you make something new or improve what you already have

• Meet awesome people who enjoy talking about this stuff as much as you do

Or, you can be a fly on the wall. No pressure at all. Feel free to drop in to just listen and see what internet marketing really looks like from people who are actually doing it.

These meetings tend to run between 1.5-2 hours. Here's the way it works:

7:00pm Join the meeting here:

https://hangouts.google.com/hangouts/_/daviddrayton.com/weeklyautomatedincomemastermindmeeting

First, new members introduce themselves, and existing members talk about what goals they hit and didn't hit in the past week. This part usually takes about 15 minutes. The remainder of our time is spent helping one of our members overcome any problems they may be facing by giving them a chance to sit on the "Couch of Insight!" Long story short, with our dozens of years of experience and our huge diversity of current business projects, we give them brutal but constructive feedback on their plans and current projects, helping them get insights they could never get from their friends and family alone.

Anyone can join. It doesn't matter where you are, how older you are, or even what stage of your business you're in. Our regular members include everyone from total beginners who are just getting their feet wet all the way up to serial entrepreneurs who are already making six-figures or more in their spare time doing this stuff.

results.name: Weekly Remote Mastermind Session

results.description:
Welcome to the weekly BKBS Wednesday meet up. Please join us at 7:00 PM by the 3rd table station in the middle of the top roping / lead area. If you are still by the bouldering wall, keep on walking.

We usually meet there for about 10 mins, and then team up in groups of 2 or 3 for top-rope climbing.

If you know that you'll be late, let us know in the comments section, and maybe tell us what you'll be wearing, so we can look out for you. 

BKBS (http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before climbing on the ropes. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need?  You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time?  Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): 

Day Pass - $25 (Students $20) 
10 Pack - $225 (Students $180)

(Membership Pricing also available)

RENTALS: 

Shoes - $5 
Harness - $5 
Chalk Bag - $2 
Full Gear Kit - $11
results.how_to_find_us: The third table in the middle of the climbing area between 7:00-7:10 PM. It's the table in the middle of the TR \/ Lead area.

results.description:
Our brand new lighter games meetup event.  This is a great opportunity to socialize and play games in a relaxed environment -- and best of all, there's no cap on attendance.

We are a casual group of people who enjoy playing complex board games -- the kind of board games that make you think. We play a variety of games, but the games at this particular event are going to be on the smaller side -- because those are often the games that work best in a cafe setting.

Our main meetup requires RSVPs due to heavy popularity and finite space.  This event runs simultaneously, two buildings away.  RSVPs are NOT required for this event.  RSVPs are still appreciated so the event hosts know how many people to expect, but you don't need to update them and can come even if you don't RSVP.

This event takes place once a week (alternating Mondays and Wednesdays), from 7:00 - 9:30.  Sometimes members will go to a nearby bar (like Champions or Meadhall) afterwards for more gaming.  Please note that our other meetup is still full at this hour, so it is not usually possible to attend both meetups in the same night.

Cosi Cafe has graciously allowed us to use their back seating area every week.  You are not required to buy anything from them, but their food is honestly pretty good, so please take advantage of them if you are hungry for dinner, soft drinks, or snacks.

We play whatever people bring, but you don't have to bring anything -- the hosts will always have a bag of games with them!  Some games that you might expect to see here include:

Red 7, Love Letter, Codenames, Pictomania, The Resistance, Avalon, One Night Ultimate Werewolf, Bang!, Glory to Rome, Innovation, Mottainai, Chrononaughts, Time Lines, Tash-Kalar

If you're looking for longer or larger Euros (like 7 Wonders, Puerto Rico, or Terra Mystica), check out our regular "Game Night" meetup.

If you haven't played these kind of games before, but think you'll like them, you're welcome too!  But be aware that you are NOT likely to find traditional American games (like Monopoly, Sorry, Risk, or Poker); heavy strategy or negotiation games (like 18xx, wargames, or Diplomacy); or pure abstract games (like Chess).

OUTBOUND (from Boston / from Park Street)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the front of the train. Cross the street. (If you take the escalator up, turn around first to see the street.) After crossing, turn left and walk about 20 feet to Cosi.

INBOUND (from Alewife / Porter / Harvard / Central)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the rear of the train. Take the stairs up, then up again towards the busy street, which is Main Street.  Turn left and walk about 20 feet to Cosi.

FROM BOSTON (or Memorial Drive) 
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading north (cross the river if coming from Boston).  Memorial Drive is the first cross street past the river; go past it. 
2) Take the first right, onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the first right after Memorial Drive.) 
3) Take the first right, onto Main St. 
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical.
5) One side of the parking lot has a bunch of buildings with a handicapped ramp leading into it.  Go up the ramp, through the walkway, and Cosi will be right next to you when you come out.

FROM CAMBRIDGE (or points west) 
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading south. 
2) Take a left onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the last left before Memorial Drive; there is a railroad crossing there.) 
3) Take the first right, onto Main St. 
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical.
5) One side of the parking lot has a bunch of buildings with a handicapped ramp leading into it.  Go up the ramp, through the walkway, and Cosi will be right next to you when you come out.

results.description:
Welcome new members!  Please note, RSVPs are required to attend this 35-person, multi-site game night.  The open RSVP spots on Meetup are for new members.


We are a casual group of people who enjoy playing complex board games -- the kind of board games that make you think. We play a variety of games, most of which are Euro style games of medium complexity.  Games often last 90 minutes or more and involve juggling a lot of rules and factors in your head, to decide what to do.  However, there's also plenty of laughter and friendship involved.  If that sounds up your alley, we hope you'll join us. 

Our weekly meetup is in a TERRIFIC space for games steps from the Kendall Square T, with easy parking, and lots of room to spread out in.  Full directions are below.  The building door does get locked in the evening, but there is plenty of foot traffic in and out.  If you expect to arrive later than 8:30, send Tucker a message earlier in the day, and we'll make sure someone is there to let you in.

Our meetups happen once a week (alternating Mondays and Wednesdays), from 7:00 pm onwards.  Our group has been running since 2007, and we have about 35 attendees each week, including regulars and new members.

1. Due to finite space, you must RSVP to attend.  If you are having a hard time getting a spot, please send a message to the organizer and we will try to work something out!

2. Please be considerate of others -- only RSVP if you are likely to attend.

3. If you have a good time, we ask new members for a one-time donation of $5 towards our site fees.  Other than that, game night is completely free!

4. Please save loud and/or big games (like those with real-time arguing) for after 9:30, when the room is less full.  This allows us to accommodate more people, and play a greater variety of games.

We play whatever people bring, which typically includes a lot of Euros.  Here's a "tip of the iceberg" look at a few games that have been popular lately:

7 Wonders, Terra Mystica, Race for the Galaxy, Splendor, One Night Werewolf, Le Havre, Hansa Teutonica, Machi Koro, Concordia, Super Big Boggle

As you can see, there is some real variety.  (We do play some light games, but if that's the main thing you want to play, please try our Light Game Night instead!)  Our regular attendees bring about 20-30 games between them, so there's always a lot to choose from.  But if you have a game you like, just bring it with you!

If you haven't played these kind of games before, but think you'll like them, you're welcome too!  But be aware that you are NOT likely to find traditional American games (like Monopoly, Sorry, Risk, or Poker); heavy strategy or negotiation games (like 18xx, wargames, or Diplomacy); or pure abstract games (like Chess).

Finally, a note about Settlers of Catan, Carcassonne, and Ticket to Ride.  These are traditional "gateway games" that many people play when they first discover Euros.  Although you will occasionally find those games at our meetups, many of us have played them to death and have become more interested in games with a little more complexity to them.

OUTBOUND (from Boston / from Park Street)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the front of the train. Cross the street. (If you take the escalator up, turn around first to see the street.) After crossing, proceed behind the T entrance (perpendicular to Main Street).  Building E25 is the brick building a quarter block down, across from the parking lot.

INBOUND (from Alewife / Porter / Harvard / Central)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the rear of the train. Take the stairs or elevator straight up. Proceed straight ahead (perpendicular to Main Street). Building E25 is the brick building a quarter block down, across from the parking lot.

FROM BOSTON (or Memorial Drive)
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading north (cross the river if coming from Boston).  Memorial Drive is the first cross street past the river; go past it.
2) Take the first right, onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the first right after Memorial Drive.)
3) Take the first right, onto Main St.
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical. Exit the parking lot at the rear (opposite from where you entered). Building E25 will be directly across the street.

FROM CAMBRIDGE (or points west)
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading south.
2) Take a left onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the last left before Memorial Drive; there is a railroad crossing there.)
3) Take the first right, onto Main St.
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical. Exit the parking lot at the rear (opposite from where you entered). Building E25 will be directly across the street.

Once you enter, Room 119 is just past the stairs on the right.  We ask new members for a one-time donation of $5.00 that goes towards site fees.

Feel free to email with any questions -- we hope to see you at a meetup soon.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk a quarter of a block from the Kendall T, in the opposite direction from the Marriott Plaza. We're in the big building on your right (across from the parking lot). When you enter, our room is just across the foyer and on your right.

results.description:
Join the Boston Austrian Economics Group as we embark upon Chapter 20: Interest, Credit Expansion, and the Trade Cycle, from the Austrian classic; "Human Action: A Treatise on Economics," by Ludwig von Mises. The group will discuss the weekly reading and questions.

Please note the readings are not required to attend our meeting, but are recommended. As always, anyone interested in economics is welcome.

Fuji has plenty of parking and is accessible via the Orange Line "Assembly" stop. Our group will be in the restaurant's private room.

Please feel free to call Natalya @[masked], our Director of Events, with any questions.

READING: 

Part 4, Chapter 20: Interest, Credit Expansion, and the Trade Cycle

Study Guide by Robert Murphy

STUDY QUESTIONS: 

(Section 1: The Problems)
1. What is the definition of the neutral rate of interest?
2. What is the definition of the gross money rate of interest?

(Section 2: The Entrepreneurial Component in the Gross Market Rate of Interest)
3. How does the entrepreneurial component in all species of loans manifest itself?

(Section 3: The Price Premium as Component of the Gross Market Rate of Interest)
4. How do the speculations of the promoters influence the gross market rate of interest?
5. Why can’t price premiums render the interest rate neutral?
6. How do price premiums come into existence?

(Section 4: The Loan Market)
7. What role does the rate of interest play with regard to business planning?
8. How can the supply of money affect the market interest rate? 9. How does it affect the originary rate of interest?

(Section 5: The Effects of Changes in the Money Relation Upon Originary Interest)
10. What are the consequences of forced saving for originary interest?
11. How can inflation provide the illusion of profits?

(Section 6: The Gross Market Rate of Interest as Affected by Inflation and Credit Expansion)
12. How can it be that the German Reichsbank’s discount rate of 90 percent was, in the fall of 1923, a low rate?
13. In what way can credit expansion create booms? Are they durable? Why are these booms not long lasting?
14. How can a general rise in prices occur?
15. What are the differences between an artificial boom created by credit expansion and a normal expansion of production with regard to capital goods?
16. If one wants to know whether there is an artificial expansion underway, where should one look?
17. Why is it important to stress the difference between malinvestment and overinvestment?
18. Why do commodity prices not necessarily rise within a period of credit expansion?

(Section 7: The Gross Market Rate of Interest as Affected by Deflation and Credit Contraction)
19. What are the essential consequences of deflation and credit restriction?

(Section 8: The Monetary or Circulation Credit Theory of the Trade Cycle)
20. What are the two shortcomings of the British Currency School, according to Mises?
21. Can a new influx of gold create a credit expansion?

(Section 9. The Market Economy as Affected by the Recurrence of the Trade Cycle)
22. Why are there always unsold inventories in the changing economy?
23. Can unused capacity justify a credit expansion?
24. Can there be a nonmonetary explanation of the trade cycle?
results.how_to_find_us: Our group will be in the restaurant's private room.
results.name: Interest, Credit Expansion, and the Trade Cycle
